results.description:
Join this free Intro to find out all about these fabulous upcoming Boston events by visiting Tantra Educator and Performer, Freddy Zental Weaver:


•  October 2nd - Sexual Enlightenment: One-Man Show

• October 3rd - Rewrite Your Love Story Workshop

• October 4th - Tantric Massage Workshop

Register here to receive the webinar link and call in info:

https://tantranova.leadpages.co/virtual-intro-boston/


Here is what you can expect from the Virtual Intro:


What practices you'll learn in the Rewrite Your Love Story workshop for:

Clearing out “what holds you back”; Feeling freedom around love, sex and intimacy; Living your life beyond fears and doubts in terms of love and intimacy; A new appreciation of your story as it pertains to love, sex and intimacy

How you will achieve this:

The process you will go through employs tantric meditation and breathing practices, theater-based technologies, emotional release exercises and improvisation to embody your NEW story you created.

More info: http://www.meetup.com/Tantric-Intimacy/events/224474845/

All about the Tantric Massage Workshop on October 4:

How you can learn and use tantric touch and holds and intentional massage to create intimacy

More info: http://www.meetup.com/Tantric-Intimacy/events/224479460/

All about the Sexual Enlightenment Show on October 2:

You will hear about how to take a truly entertaining and often hilarious journey through Freddy Zental’s life experiences concerning intimacy, sex and love. The show is packed with storytelling, drumming, singing and comedy. All are used in service of demystifying those intimate, personally impacting moments that so often go unexamined or trivialized, like your first exposure to sexual energy, your first orgasm or your first true love.

More info: http://www.meetup.com/Tantric-Intimacy/events/224474666/

About Freddy Zental Weaver and Dr. Elsbeth Meuth:

They are the founders and directors of the TantraNova Institute in Chicago. They are internationally renowned workshop leaders, relationship and intimacy coaches and certified Tantra Yoga teachers and were featured on Showtimes' documentary series Sexual Healing and the Emmy Award Winning NBC show Starting Over.

Reserve your space NOW: https://tantranova.leadpages.co/virtual-intro-boston/


See you there!

results.description:
Contact: Roberta Dehman Hershon
Telephone: [masked]
September 9th in Downtown Salem

Going, Going……. Almost Gone: “When Giants Fall”
The Elephant Poaching Crisis
Discussion and Benefit Screening

Every 15 minutes, a wild elephant dies by human hands. Those hands belong to poachers. Poachers involved in the illegal ivory trade. These gentle giants will go the way of the Black Rhino if we do not step in NOW to stop the senseless killing, trafficking and demand for ivory.

The statistics are clear: In 1979 there were 1.3 million elephants roaming free. Today, that number has dwindled to fewer than 400,000. 35,000 African and Asian elephants were slain last year. Another 35,000 will lose their lives in 2015.

According to The International Fund for Animal Welfare, Boston is the fourth largest market for ivory jewelry and trinkets in the United States.

On September 9 at 8:30 p.m. join the people behind the Global March For Elephants Rhinos (GMFER) at the Massachusetts’ documentary preview of When Giants Fall and learn what YOU can do to stop these horrific acts.


CinemaSalem, 1 East India Square Mall, Salem, MA 

Preceding the film, Senator Jason Lewis and Representative Lori Ehrlich, authors of legislation to prevent ivory and rhino horn trafficking in MA along with Tom Lang, co-owner of Alexander Westerhoff Antiques, will lead a panel discussion at 6:30 p.m. 
SalemFive Community Room
210 Essex Street
Downtown Salem, MA 01970

Tickets for both events are $25.00. 
Screening alone: $10; 
Panel discussion alone: $15. 
RSVP required. 
Email [masked]. 
Boston GMFER is an all-volunteer organization that supports education, advocacy and financial assistance for elephant/rhino anti-poaching organizations.
results.name: Going, Going……. Almost Gone: “When Giants Fall”

results.description:
Ellen Jaffe JonesThe Veg Coach

Creative Cook / Author / Consultant
From our test kitchen to your home kitchen

OK, show of hands.  How many of you eat quinoa as a side dish?
Most cooks use the protein-rich grain as a substitute for rice.
But, I've got a treat for you today.  It's a recipe for Quinoa crisp chocolate balls!
What a way to reward yourself for following a healthy lifestyle.

Find it below.

Consider this too as a tasty approach to getting people interested in coming to one of my FREE cooking classes. This week, Wednesday at 9pm EST, I'll be doing a free class prepping and serving 2 recipes from my book "Eat Vegan on $4 a Day." Bring any questions to our Google Hangout: 

https://plus.google.com/events/c0oegddjuh07utbrq1mv6vm1rfg

Happy cooking,

Ellen Jaffe Jones
The Veg Coach
http://www.vegcoach.com

Buy my books:

Paleo Vegan

Eat Vegan on $4 a Day

Kitchen Divided - Vegan Recipes for Semi-Vegan Households

This is a Quinoa crisp chocolate bar you might find at your local health food store.  
But, my recipe lets you create your own Quinoa chocolate treat.  

It'll satisfy your chocolate cravings and it's so easy to make.  

The recipe is below.

You're Going to Love This!  

Quinoa Crisp Chocolate Treats
by Ellen Jaffe Jones

INGREDIENTS 

1 cup vegan chocolate chips
1/2 cup puffed quinoa
4 teaspoons coconut oil
1/8 teaspoon salt (optional)

PREPARATION INSTRUCTIONS

1 cup vegan chocolate chips
1/2 cup puffed quinoa
4 teaspoons coconut oil
1/8 teaspoon salt (optional)

Melt chocolate chips in a double-boiler, or place in a microwave-safe bowl and heat for about 60 seconds until the chips develop a slight sheen.  
Place all ingredients in a medium pot (or add to the double-boiler) and over medium heat, and stir constantly for about 5 minutes taking care not to burn the chocolate. 
Form small balls and place on a non-stick cookie sheet.  
Refrigerate for at least 60 minutes before serving.  
For those wanting to reduce fat intake, this can be made without the coconut oil, but make sure the chocolate chips are completely melted.

The Security of Things Forum - a full day event with two tracks and some excellent hands-on demos is coming up Sept. 10 in Cambridge, MA at the Sheraton Commander in Harvard Square. Check out the web site here.


As a IOT Boston/New England member, you get 1/2 price admission to this event. Just use the PROMO code IOTMU, or this link:


https://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-security-of-things-forum-tickets-17108148934?discount=IOTMU­


And, if you want to attend, but can't swing the cost of admission, no worries. I have a small number of free passes to the Forum that I've set aside for Security of Things MeetUp members. Just email me at:

[masked]

and let us know, I'll give you the code to get your free pass!


We have an amazing agenda. Chris will be hosting a panel on IoT innovators, including executives from iRobot, Sypris and Foley and Lardner. Also speaking at the show will be: 


Chris Valasek, Researcher at Uber Inc.'s Advanced Technologies Group.

Chris was one half of the two person team that developed a method of wirelessly hacking into a Jeep Cherokee at the Black Hat briefings. This is his first Boston appearance since joining Uber.


Julie Brill, Commissioner at the FTC. J

ulie will participate in a panel hosted by Passcode and entitled "Security, Privacy and the IoT: A Policy Perspective." This is Julie's first appearance in Boston since a critical court ruling giving the FTC authority to regulate cyber security.


Chris Rouland, CEO of Bastille:

Chris founded ISS and its X-Force security labs. Now he's turned his attention to securing the IoT. Find out what he has to say.


Ben Ransford, CTO of Virta Labs -

Virta has developed technology to detect malware using power analysis - the patterns that form as a device consumes electricity. Come hear about this new form of endpoint interrogation that is totally platform independent and well -suited to IoT applications.


We look forward to seeing you there!

The Loved Child (TLC) offers Developmental Play & Parenting Classes from the newborn period through the preschool years. Each class is designed to equally support the child’s learning & development through play and to provide expert-lead parenting support.

Each weekly TLC class follows a predictable routine and includes:

• Developmental Focus: Social/Emotional, Cognitive, Expressive & Receptive Language, Fine & Gross Motor, Sensory, Creative, Musical, Dramatic, and Nature & Sustainability.

• Developmental Group Activity: Sand/water sensory play, creative art projects, gross motor equipment, musical instruments, dramatic play materials, cognitive cause & effect toys, puzzles, fine motor activities etc.

Parent Topic: Temperament, Healthy Family Eating, Healthy Family Sleep, Challenging Behaviors, Toilet Training, Parents Taking Care of Themselves, Positive Discipline, and Community Resources.

In preparation for each class, families receive the TLC Weekly Newsletter with an overview of theTLC Developmental Focus, TLC Parent Topic and TLC Take Home Idea- links to creative, fun, and trusted blog sites with activities specific to the reviewed area of development. Please click HERE for a sample TLC Weekly Newsletter.

On the first day of the class semester, every family, beginning with the TLC Infant Class, is given the TLC Class Book for daily reading at home.

For a more detailed description of the Developmental Play & Parenting classes, please read the following articles: Overview of TLC Classes and Class Routine.

results.description:
Join Certified Laughter Yoga Teacher Linda Hamaker on Thursday, September 10th at 9:30am as she shows you simple exercises to help you add more joyful laughter to your life! 

FREE for seniors 55 and older.

Laughter yoga is a fun new exercise of laughing and clapping combined with gentle breathing techniques. When you pretend to laugh or act happy, your body produces the same happiness chemicals and you get all the same health benefits of laughing. Laughing strengthens the immune system, unwinds the negative effects of stress, lowers blood pressure, lowers blood sugar levels, improves mental alertness, enhances blood oxygen levels, boosts circulation, and makes you feel good in the here and now by lifting your spirits. 

There are no fancy movements or contortions. Anyone can do it and you can sit or stand. Please bring your water bottle as laughing is dehydrating. Linda is the co-founder of Let's Laugh Today and is a graduate of the American School of Laughter Yoga and Dr. Kataria’s International School of Laugher Yoga. More information about laughter yoga can be found at www.letslaughtoday.com
results.name: LET'S LAUGH TODAY WITH LINDA

group.name: Let's Laugh Today based on LAUGHTER YOGA

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.

results.description:
I missed the Strandbeests when they were out in public, so I'm hoping to get into this talk on Thursday. I'll have a meetup sign (or maybe sticker), some sit nearby and we can talk about the event before and after. - H

MLTalks: Theo Jansen in conversation with Neri Oxman and Trevor Smith
Thursday, September 10, 2015 | 3:00pm - 5:00pm
Location:
MIT Media Lab, 3rd Floor Atrium

All talks at the Media Lab, unless otherwise noted, are open to the public.


This talk will be webcast. 

Join the conversation on Twitter: #MLTalks

This talk will not be ticketed. Seating is on a first-come, first-served basis. Line will form for seating in the Media Lab lobby (75 Amherst Street, Kendall Square, Cambridge) beginning at 2pm. We are unable to accommodate visitors or attendees before 2pm.

During the question-and-answer session, the panel will be joined by photographer Lena Herzog, whose photographs of the artist's work are collected in the book Strandbeest: The Dream Machines of Theo Jansen.

Please contact [masked] with questions about this event.
Biography: Theo Jansen first came to prominence in 1980 when he flew a "UFO" across the skies of Delft, Holland. For the past 20 years Jansen has been creating and exhibiting his dramatic, kinetic Strandbeests. He has appeared on multiple TED Talks, been the subject of a profile in The New Yorker and shown his work in Asia, Europe and now the United States. A trained physicist, Jansen’s Strandbeests bridge the gap between art and engineering, attracting a broad array of followers: from engineers, biologists, and philosophers, to environmentalists, writers and makers.

Designer Neri Oxman is the Sony Corporation Career Development and associate professor of Media Arts and Sciences at the MIT Media Lab, where she founded and directs the Mediated Matter research group. Her group explores how digital design and fabrication technologies mediate between matter and environment to radically transform the design and construction of objects, buildings, and systems. Oxman coined the term “material ecology” to describe the study and design of products and processes integrating environmentally aware, computational, form-generation processes and digital fabrication. Her goal is to enhance the relationship between the built and the natural environments by employing design principles inspired by nature, and implementing them in the invention of novel digital design technologies. Areas of application include product and architectural design, as well as digital fabrication and construction. Oxman was named to ICON's list of the 20 most influential architects to shape our future (2009), and was selected as one of the “100 most creative people” by Fast Company (2009). In 2008, she was named "Revolutionary Mind" by SEED Magazine. Her work has been exhibited at MoMA (NYC) and is part of the museum's permanent collection. In 2012 the Centre Georges Pompidou Museum (Paris, France) acquired her works for its permanent collection. Other exhibitions include the Smithsonian Institute (Washington, DC), Museum of Science (Boston, MA), FRAC Collection (Orleans, France), and the 2010 Beijing Biennale. She is included in prestigious private collections and has received numerous awards including a 40 Under 40 Building Design + Construction Award (2012), a Graham Foundation Carter Manny Award (2008), the International Earth Award for Future-Crucial Design (2009), and a METROPOLIS Next Generation Award (2009). Oxman received her PhD in design computation as a Presidential Fellow at MIT, where she developed the theory and practice of material-based design computation. In this approach, the shaping of material structure is conceived of as a novel form of computation. Prior to studying at MIT, she earned her diploma from the Architectural Association (RIBA 2) after attending the Faculty of Architecture and Town Planning at the Technion Israel Institute of Technology, and the Department of Medical Sciences at the Hebrew University in Jerusalem.

Trevor Smith is PEM’s Curator of the Present Tense. Prior to joining the Peabody Essex, Smith was Curator in Residence at the Center for Curatorial Studies, Bard College where in 2006 he co-curated Wrestle, the inaugural exhibition at the Hessel Museum and in 2007 presented is Martin Creed: Feelings, the first large-scale survey of this artist’s work. From[masked] he was Curator at the New Museum of Contemporary Art in New York City where, among other projects he co-curated the widely acclaimed exhibition Andrea Zittel: Critical Space and presented a major survey of the work of Brian Jungen. From[masked] he was based in Australia where he worked first at the Biennale of Sydney, then as Director of the Canberra Contemporary Art Space, and from[masked] as Curator of Contemporary Art at the Art Gallery of Western Australia. Trevor has produced over fifty exhibitions and has published widely in exhibition catalogues and journals in North America, Europe, Australia, and Asia.

Photo: Lena Herzog
results.name: MLTalks: Theo Jansen in conversation with Neri Oxman and Trevor Smith

results.description:
***********************

To join the Sept. Tournament please just go through our Join Page:  http://TennisNorthEast.com/join
***********************


How does the TennisNorthEast Tournament Work?

Every Match Counts *NEW* for 2015

Tennis Tournament Basic Concept

 Our tournaments are a single elimination format with a consolation bracket. Meaning you are guaranteed at least 2 matches. This tournament format will not be played at a single location over a weekend instead players are given 7 to 10 days to play each round's match.

 Our tournaments will be mixed gender unless we have particularly strong female enrollment in a city. The tournaments will be singles based until we receive enough response to open it up for doubles. Players will be grouped in brackets with players no greater than .5 of their current TLN League Rating. Meaning Skilled - 3.0 players will be matched with other 3.0 players and at most with Competitive - 3.5 level players. Competitive - 3.5 level players could be grouped with Advanced - 4.0 players but will not have Elite 4.5 level players in their bracket.

Our Guarantee

 We need at least 6 players to make a tournament bracket. If we can NOT reach this criteria then we will refund your entry fee and give you the next tournament for no cost. Our hope is to run multiple skill level brackets for each tournament. We are NOT going to show early enrollment for the tournaments. Also the 7-day money back guarantee expires as soon as the tournament starts. Tournaments will not allow for late enrollment.

Leveling

 All tournament players will need to have played 4 league/season or tennis ladder legacy matches before they can enter into a tournament. Players will be entered into the tournament that associates with their TLN's Player Rating. If a player wants to participate in a second draw at a rating higher than their Player Rating they will be allowed too.

Your Schedule and Availability

 These tournaments will be kicked off on Thursday's giving the first round opponents two weekends to play the first match and then each following round will have a full week to play the match. Players need to be local for at least the first 3 weeks after kickoff. Players with 1-week work trips or week long vacations during the first 3 weeks shouldn't participate in the tournament.

Seedings

  The TennisNorthEast staff will seed 25% of the participants based veteran status (Most number of matches played in their career) with the program. If we have 8 players enrolled we'll seed the top 2 players, 16 players the top 4 players. The rest of the players will be randomly entered into the draw.

Consolation Bracket

 We will run a consolation bracket for the players who lost their first match. Seedings for the consolation bracket will be randomly selected by the TennisNorthEast staff. The winner of the consolation bracket will receive a $25 Tennis Warehouse Gift Card.

Where to Play?

  Because the seeding of the tournament is mainly randomize the higher seed will NOT have home court preference. The league strongly suggests you meet half-way to cut the commute in half for both players. We provide an extensive list of tennis courts that have user submitted ratings. If two players need guidance they can certainly email our staff for suggestions.

Playing Format

  The preferred playing format for tournaments should be 2 sets with a 3rd set tie-breaker or 2 out of 3 sets. If the two players can't agree the default format will be the 2 sets with a 3rd set tie-breaker. In NYC we will accept 10 game pro set results mainly due to court availability.

Target Audience

  This will be our most competitive format. The target audience is for the player who are good sports and love to play competitive matches.

Prize Pool

 The prize pool will be based upon enrollment in each bracket. A tournament can have multiple brackets. The tournament prize structure is based around our partner Tennis Warehouse (TW).

6 to 10 players: $50 TW Gift Card for the winner*, $25 TW GC for Finalist, $25 TW GC for Consolation bracket winner
11 to 16: $100 TW GC for the winner* + Trophy, $50 TW GC for Finalist, $25 TW GC for Consolation winner
17 to 24: $150 TW GC for the winner* + Trophy, $50 TW GC for Finalist, $25 TW GC for 3rd & 4th place, $50 TW GC for Consolation winner
25+: $200 TW GC for the winner* + Trophy, $100 TW GC for Finalist, $25 TW GC for 3rd and 4th place, $50 TW GC for Consolation winner

 All tournament champions will be receive an entry into the End of the Year National Tourneys at the champions discounted rate.

Cost to Participate

 The cost will be $19.95 per tournament except for the inaugural tournament which will be $19.95.

Join Today!!

So Join Today and we'd be happy to get you enrolled into the next tournament.

results.description:
Le Dîner en Blanc® is a cool idea which began over twenty-five years ago in Paris.

It's a classy elegant flash mob picnic for which you dress in all white (including your accessories; bag, shoes, hat, belt, socks, stockings, jewelry silver and/or white), dine from white dinner plates placed on white tables with white linen while seated on white chairs.

Waiting List Registration Opened Today Wednesday August 5, 2015.

Final Phase Registration Opens Promptly at 10AM Wednesday August 19th.

Strongly Encourage You Schedule a Reminder in Your Phone to be on Le Dîner en Blanc® site to register, </a>http://boston.dinerenblanc.info/register

FYI, Recently DC's Final Registration Sold Out in Thirty-Five (35) Minutes!!!!

Le Dîner en Blanc® is much more than a simple picnic. It is a spontaneous movement that puts simple values such as friendship, elegance, heritage, respect and secrecy... at the heart of the concept.

There are no commercial intents, political affiliation or charitable associations.

Today, over 60 cities around the world have hosted their own Le Dîner en Blanc® events. Boston was chosen to host for a second time because it's a wonderful metropolitan area rich in architecture and social history.

Here is a video which will give you an idea <a href="http://mandrillapp.com/track/click/30012314/www.youtube.com?">

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9D6Uv1Vcvus

This picnic has RULES! which helps make it more of a performance art piece than a casual backyard gathering.

RULES:

• You MUST dress in all WHITE (including all accessories such as bag, shoes, hat, belt, tie, bowtie, cummerband, pocket square, gloves, scarf, panty hose/stockings, socks/knee highs, jewlery white and/or silver)

• You MUST bring everything SUCH AS:

1) WHITE table

2) WHITE CHAIR

3) WHITE BASKET/BAG to carry your food and drinks for sharing

4) WHITE PLATES (can NOT be PAPER nor PLASTIC)

5) SILVER UTENSILS

6) WHITE TABLE ACCESSORIES such as tablecloth, napkins, balloons, candles, etc.

• Originality and Creativity in your table setting is encouraged as long as it is stylish and tasteful.

You may NOT BRING ANY alcohol HOWEVER you may purchase wine or champagne online before SEPTEMBER 4th. All orders will be picked up onsite that night.

Take out FOOD is permitted, but handmade food is better! You also may purchase food online before SEPTEMBER 4th. All orders will be picked up onsite that night.

• This is an ADULT dinner- NO children are allowed. Please plan accordingly!

• There will a DJ to get us out of our seats to dance.

• WEATHER: The date will move IF pouring rain or worse, but the decision won't be made until the afternoon of September 10th.

• PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION is HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

Parking will be at a premium which requires everyone's cooperation so the desired effect is achieved

BEFORE we leave we will pickup everything (including our garbage) and depart, leaving NO trace.

This secret affair promises an unforgettable evening of elegance, beauty, and magic as it takes over an iconic location for food, fun, celebration, and dancing set against the Boston skyline!

Let me know if you have any questions!

You don't want to miss this experience!!! 

... à la prochaine!!!

photo from Le Dîner en Blanc® 2012

results.description:
Can two serial cheaters get a second chance at love? After a one-night stand in college, New Yorkers Lainey (Alison Brie) and Jake (Jason Sudeikis) meet by chance twelve years later and discover they each have the same problem: because of their monogamy-challenged ways, neither can maintain a relationship. Determined to stay friends despite their mutual attraction, they make a pact to keep it platonic, a deal that proves easier said than done. Fresh, funny, and full of witty insights about modern love, this hilariously heartfelt film “is the rare rom-com that reminds us why we love them so much in the first place” (Time Out New York). Amanda Peet, Adam Scott, Natasha Lyonne, and Jason Mantzoukas co-star.

results.description:
Hosted by: Beyond Your Hammock & Claudia Connects

Beyond Your Hammock and Claudia Connects are back to bring you another A Night in the Hammock!! As most of you know by now, this isn't your typical networking event. It's social... it's business... it's life! 

Have you found the key to success? Great, come share it with us. Are you stuck in a rut? Not so great, but come share that as well. Our goal is to create an environment that supports you in getting to the next level, no matter where you might be today. Now is only temporary and we have 100% of our lives to live. Let's make the most of it! 

There will be complimentary crudité and cheese and crackers. Also, if you are driving to the event, you can park at 75 State Street and the Harborside Inn will validate your ticket for a discounted rate.

Please check out <a>photos </a>from our May 20th event.

Thank you!

"The discomfort of choosing to do something outside of your comfort zone is temporary... it's the distress of not doing it that lasts forever."  - Eric Roberge, Founder of Beyond Your Hammock

NEXT LEVEL BUSINESS FORUM brings together business-owners, -coaches, and -service-providers, for enlightened discussions. Each participant, expert in his own field, benefits from the others’ perspectives.

This WEEK Business owners will learn and gain insights from our experts, and we’ll be experimenting with ‘speed expert dating.’ Yay!

See more details in the agenda below.


--

GETTING HERE

Join us at MIT's Cambridge Innovation Center, 1 Broadway, Cambridge, 5th floor, Cozumel Room

• Register as a guest at the front desk and mention that you're attending our event on the 5th floor.

• Optionally: Meet us at Venture Cafe for networking before the event. Venture Cafe serves as a physical nexus for helping innovators and entrepreneurs find one another and collaborate to bring their dreams to reality.  All attendees to the Cafe should adhere to the Venture Cafe contributor model (http://vencaf.org/thursdaycafeboston/contributor-model/) and credo (http://vencaf.org/credo/). Learn more here: vencaf.org.

--


QUESTIONS? NEED HELP?

- Contact Ian: [masked], call or text: (802)[masked]

- Look for the Gain Street sign or anyone wearing a green Gain Street T-shirt in the Venture Cafe before our event


--

AGENDA

5 pm - Optional networking at Venture Cafe

*Venture Cafe is a members-only club for innovators. Learn more here: vencaf.org


6 pm - FREE PIZZA - Gain Street's Next Level Business Forum

Follow signs to the Cozumel Room on the 5th floor.

Need help getting here? Contact [masked], call or text: (802)[masked]

1. Intros

2. Bring your hardest problems and collaborate with other entrepreneurs and experts in a group setting

3. Our expert panel will be sharing ideas on taking businesses to the ‘next level’

--

REQUESTS & FEEDBACK - [masked]


Let us know what you want most from this group! We’d love to hear your ideas about how we can use our resources to help businesses get to the next level.

--


GAIN STREET


Have you heard about Gain Street??


...Gain Street is the best place to get help for your business.


We're a funded startup at MIT's Cambridge Innovation Center, and we're building an app that's also a "business coach"


Leveling up your “Gain Street Cred” improves your business in real life.


On Gain Street you can

- See how you stack up against other businesses like you

- Get help from coaches and experts where you need it most

- And discover opportunities to take your business to the next level


Learn more about us at 

www.GainStreet.co

results.description:
Come network and hear about integrating Elasticsearch with .Net . Food and refreshments will be provided. When you arrive at WeWork, head up to the 2nd floor. There will be signs for the meetup.

Elasticsearch/Cassandra/Spark on Windows

Abstract

Want to hear the trials and tribulations of wrestling Elasticsearch, Cassandra  and Spark into a Windows environment? Why building for the web has some real gotchas (especially when using IIS) and how you can get round them? We'll look at a real-world Lambda architecture built around these components - and drill down into the Elasticsearch/.Net integration, as an example of some of those gotchas and the solutions available.


Speaker Bio

As Chief Technology Officer and co-founder of PCA Predict, Jamie is responsible for the data-as-a-service infrastructure that powers over 10,000 businesses globally. Jamie has a considerable knowledge of how to develop a scalable SaaS platform which meets the resilience and reliability requirements of the on-demand market. Jamie is also leading the product development of Triggar.com - a new real-time, big data, analytics platform powered by Cassandra, Spark and Elasticsearch. Jamie holds a first-class honours degree in Computing Science from Aston University, where he received a faculty accolade for 'an outstanding contribution to technological innovation.


What's new in Elasticsearch 2.0

Abstract

The Elasticsearch 2.0 release is just around the corner. In this talk we will cover new features, breaking changes and migration strategy for the next major release. 

Speaker Bio

Igor Motov is a software developer on the Elasticsearch core team based out of the Boston area where he also serves as a co-organizer of the Boston Elasticsearch Meetup Group. Prior to joining Elastic, Igor worked on search solutions for companies ranging from small startups to large corporations.
results.name: Elasticsearch/Cassandra/Spark on Windows And What's new in 2.0

results.description:
Join us this month for engaging presentations and lively discussions at Google in Cambridge! We're excited to have InVision sponsor the after party where you’ll have opportunities to talk shop over drinks, apps and the Patriots. Game starts at 8:30 and we'll have our own private space and big screen upstairs at Meadhall. Swing by and say hi to Brian Tino and all from InVision!

1. Educational UX Design: Crafting an Ecology Curriculum for Incarcerated Youth (6:35-7:00)

By Kim Ducharme (Twitter | LinkedIn) and Christina Bosch (Twitter | LinkedIn)

How do you shape a digital curriculum project around difficult-to-reach users — incarcerated youth? During this talk, we’ll highlight how we are leveraging user experience design in an educational context for Project RAISE (Reclaiming Access to Inquiry Science Education for Incarcerated Students). CAST, Inc. has traditionally used a research-based framework for curriculum development to design education tools that meet the widest range of learner needs. Recently, we’ve begun to borrow and integrate UXD methods to enhance and evolve our processes and products. Through workarounds and creative research strategies, we are developing an ecology curriculum that is flexible enough to address the unique needs of students and teachers, while at the same time accommodating institutional, educational, and technological constraints. 

About Kim. Kim Ducharme is Director of Design at CAST, Inc., an educational research and development organization, and formerly headed up interactive design at WGBH. At CAST, Kim heads up design strategy and user experience for the development of interactive learning environments and tools that expand learning opportunities for all individuals through Universal Design for Learning. She is committed to harnessing the power of design to tackle the educational challenges of our time. 

About Christina. As an instructional designer and research associate at CAST, Inc., Christina Bosch's work blends UX and Universal Design for Learning strategies with pedagogical expertise from special education and arts integration teaching experiences. She is interested in synthesizing approaches from multiple disciplines to tackle complex problems in education. 

2. User Assistance! (7:00-7:25) 


by Deborah Sauer | LinkedIn | Twitter

User assistance has a bad rap. And who needs it anyway? User interface design strives to make an app so intuitive that people can perform the desired task without thinking about the user interface with which they are interacting. This seamless experience is the goal, but it is difficult to attain for all use cases, all personas, and all screen sizes. Assistance still needs to be available when the user needs it, and not be in the way when the user doesn’t. We’ll look at some successful and some less than successful attempts at user assistance and discuss ways to implement user assistance in mobile apps.  

About Deborah. Deborah designs user assistance content for Sonos, Inc., a leader in wireless music systems. Previously, she designed content for companies such as Philips Consumer Electronics, Avid Technology, iRobot, and Land O’Lakes. Deborah ran her own consulting business for 12 years and taught at companies such as Sprint and Brooklyn Academy of Music. She also taught in the graduate Technical Communication program at her alma mater, Northeastern University. She is a frequent speaker at Society for Technical Communication programs and conferences. 

3. Working Effectively with Engineers (7:25-7:50)

By Mary Murray | LinkedIn

Have you ever gotten into a shouting match with an engineer over an interaction? Have you put hours into specifications only to find what the developer implemented seems to have little relationship to what you designed? If so, this talk is for you. We'll cover strategies to help make the relationship between designers and engineers more collaborative and productive. 

About Mary. Mary is a UX designer who has worked with engineers at large enterprises and tiny startups. In addition to her experience designing software, she curated the exhibit The Maker’s Revolution at the Cambridge Science Festival and displayed Interactive art at the CyberArts Festival, CyberArts Gallery, and Axiom Gallery.



4. Meadhall (8-11)


Sponsored by InVision | @InVisionApp

Head to Mead Hall for an InVision sponsored party to watch the Patriots. Food and drinks will be provided all evening by Brian Tino of InVision.


About InVision. InVision gives teams the freedom to prototype, review, iterate, manage, and user test web and mobile products—without a single line of code and all in one place. Founded in 2011, InVision helps over one million designers at companies like Evernote, Adobe, Twitter, and  Salesforce unlock the power of design-driven product development.

Physical Security 

We'd like to make things easy for Google Security. Everybody should update their meetup profile with their last name and a recent photograph. To do that, click My Profile > View Profile and you'll see the options. RSVPs close at 11am the day before the event.

Parking 

You may want to allow extra time to find a parking space, but street parking is available on the side streets. Pilgrim Parking, 350 Kendall Street has an $8 rate if you enter after 4pm.

Not receiving emails?

Some members have said they are not receiving our emails. You might have unsubscribed to our special announcements. To fix it: Click Settings > Email Updates > Choose UX Boston under "Updates about your groups" and check off "Announcement about a specific Meetup" and "Announcement to members about the group".

Why are you charging $1?  

It takes a lot of effort and time to put on these events. The nominal $1 fee and checkout process serve to verify your attendance and provide a more accurate headcount — and ensure a much better networking experience! Your modest support does enable and encourage us to continue improving these events.

Sales and Recruiters 
We appreciate your interest in our events; however, in order to keep the focus on learning and having fun in a casual environment, we request that you not engage in marketing, sales, or recruitment business at our meetups. If you would like to attend or mingle with our members in a professional capacity to promote a product or recruit, please contact us directly about sponsorship opportunities through the Meetup site. 

Looking for speakers!
If you messaged your an abstract of your talk to us in the past and haven't received a response yet, please message it again. Your message may have been buried in layers of emails. Reminders are really helpful!
results.name: Educational Design, User Assistance, and Working with Engineers!

Couch to 5K Fall Group
Interested in getting in shape but don’t know where to begin? Want to meet s

We have 2 groups:

1. Our Jogging Group has a goal of jogging a 5K.
2. Our Alumni Jogging Group has a goal of keep jogging for those who have jogged at least once season with us.

We introduce people to jogging and getting fit. The program gradually moves you from walking at your own pace to jogging at your own pace.

• FREE 10-week program to get you from the couch to running a 5K (3.1 miles) 

• Anyone from the community can participate

• Led by experienced runners

• Monday through Thursdays 6pm-6:45pm; Sundays 8am-8:45am, with a goal of joining us 3 of these sessions per week.

• 45 minute time commitment

• Goal of jogging and finishing the Stow Gobbler on Thanksgiving morning.

Encourage those you love to get “off the couch” and join you in the great sport of running. Come have some fun! Bring a water bottle and join the group.

Please consult your doctor if you have a health or medical condition that prevents you from exercising.

For more information please visit http://www.connectingpointchurch.org/couchto5k/

results.description:
SVG (Scalable Vector Graphics) gives you the drawing and animation flexibility of the canvas element along with the advantages of the DOM. SVG allows you to represent complex graphical elements as XML. SVG can provide both size and scalability advantages over traditional images.

Many modern animation libraries and frameworks make heavy use of SVG, such as raphael, vivus, svg.js, and d3. 

For this challenge, you are tasked with spending some time getting to know SVG. Produce whatever you can - be it a static image, an animation, or an interactive data visualization. Coolest usage of SVG gets 250 points on the leaderboard!

We will be meeting by the fountain in the library, and then moving upstairs to find space.
results.name: Let's SVG - Vector Drawing / Animation Challenge with JavaScript

results.description:
Please note the location change to 90 Broadway (next to Mead Hall).

The Boston Clojure Group Meetup will be held at Akamai at 90 Broadway, 12th Floor, in Cambridge, MA.  formerly known as 4 Cambridge Center. (Kendall Square). Building security may ask you to show an ID, so please have one available.

Meet & Greet starts at 6:00. Group activities will begin at 6:30.

Title: Cross-platform native app development with Clojure/ClojureScript

Speaker: Chris Vermilion of Figly


Abstract: The versatility of the JVM and JavaScript mean that Clojure/ClojureScript can be used on many platforms, perhaps even some surprising ones. The recently released RoboVM library, for example, lets you build native iOS applications in Java, and indeed Clojure. Meanwhile, many approaches now exist for building native mobile applications with JavaScript. These tools enable development of cross-platform native apps on iOS/Android/web with nearly all code shared. I'll discuss the basics of both Java- and JavaScript-based strategies, our experience with the pros and cons of each at Figly, and how we ended up using ClojureScript and React Native.

Chris Vermilion is a software developer and academia-dropout ex-physicist currently working as an engineer at Figly, a startup developing a platform for building cross-platform enterprise apps. Before that he co-founded Roobiq, a mobile CRM startup.

Future meeting ideas will be discussed over the meetup board and in our Google discussion group:  https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/boston-clojure .
results.how_to_find_us: Near the Kendall Square T stop
results.name: Cross-platform native app development with Clojure/ClojureScript

Organizer ... Michael Blair @ (978)[masked]


==========

09/07 Update: The movie is out and is getting good reviews. There is a 7:10 PM show on Thursday 09/10 so I am going to set that as the event. Unfortunately, I will not be able to make it and my schedule doesn't have much open for the next week or so. Instead of canceling it I will let you guys make the necessary arrangements with each other using the comment section below. There is a Chili's and an Outback Steakhouse in the same parking lot.


==========

While it is in my bookcase I may be one of the few in this group who haven't read this book yet. It's scheduled to open Labor Day Weekend but I plan to be enjoying the outdoors so I won't be able to go. When the schedule is released I will update this event listing - most likely be mid-week, early evening. We may get together for dinner before or after.

Sign up if you're interested in going and you will get an update when I schedule the actual event.

Here's a link to the theater.

https://www.showcasecinemas.com/theatre/3813/showcase-cinemas-lowell/lowell/ma?tab=showtimes&filter%5Bday%5D=2015-09-09


Here's a link to the movie.

http://www.walkinthewoodsmovie.com


========== 


In this new comedy adventure, celebrated travel writer, Bill Bryson (Academy Award winner Robert Redford), instead of retiring to enjoy his loving and beautiful wife (Academy Award winner Emma Thompson), and large and happy family, challenges himself to hike the Appalachian Trail - 2,200 miles of America's most unspoiled, spectacular and rugged countryside from Georgia to Maine. The peace and tranquility he hopes to find, though, is anything but, once he agrees to being accompanied by the only person he can find willing to join him on the trek - his long lost and former friend Katz (Academy Award nominee Nick Nolte), a down-on-his-luck serial philanderer who, after a lifetime of relying on his charm and wits to keep one step ahead of the law – sees the trip as a way to sneak out of paying some debts and sneak into one last adventure before its too late. The trouble is, the two have a completely different definition of the word, "adventure". Now they're about to find out that when you push yourself to the edge, the real fun begins.

==========

https://youtu.be/1NjYUr1k8rA

results.description:
Join us on Thursday, September 10, 2015 at 7:00pm for a discussion and signing by Harold S. Kushner. He will be signing his newest book “Nine Essential Things I’ve Learned About Life."

From the beloved author of When Bad Things Happen to Good People, deeply moving and illuminating reflections on what it means to live a good life. As a congregational rabbi for half a century and the best-selling author of twelve books on faith, ethics, and how to apply the timeless wisdom of religious thought to everyday challenges, Rabbi Harold S. Kushner has demonstrated time and again his understanding of the human spirit.

In this compassionate new work, his most personal since When Bad Things Happen to Good People, Kushner relates how his time as a twenty-first-century rabbi has shaped his senses of religion and morality. He elicits nine essential lessons from the sum of his teaching, study, and experience, offering a lifetime’s worth of spiritual food for thought, pragmatic advice, inspiration for a more fulfilling life, and strength for trying times. With fresh, vital insight into belief (“there is no commandment in Judaism to believe in God”), conscience (the Garden of Eden story as you’ve never heard it), and mercy (forgiveness is “a favor you do yourself, not an undeserved gesture to the person who hurt you”), grounded in Kushner's brilliant readings of Scripture, history, and popular culture, Nine Essential Things I’ve Learned About Life is compulsory reading from one of modern Judaism’s foremost sages.

Distilling the wisdom of an extraordinary career, this profoundly inspiring yet practical guide to well being is truly the capstone to Kushner’s luminous oeuvre.
results.name: Author Event: Harold S. Kushner

You can bring friends, kids, partners, or come alone. Singles are highly encouraged, couples, families with children, and adults of all ages. You'll have the best time in months, we’re sure. September 10th is the first of three open dances this autumn, all in September on Thursdays. People with no experience can join for two more weeks until we start adding calls, one by one, learning the rest of the Basic and Mainstream steps.

results.description:
Ongoing class in 18th century Scottish Broadsword and Smallsword.

The Broadsword is the archetypal weapon of the Highlander swordsman - a broad-bladed cutting and thrusting weapon. It has a basket hilt to protect the hand and wielded single-handed.

The Smallsword is the courtly weapon of the Scottish warrior class. An elegant thrusting weapon it teaches the fighter to use the thrust and make small parries. The smallsword is the immediate predecessor to modern epee.

The class covers all the basics of footwork, attacks and defenses. Drills are developed from simple to complex; from rigidly choreographed to open-ended. Timing, distance and judgement are developed.

All classes begin with a Strength & Conditioning program designed to physically prepare one for fighting with the sword. Elements develop agility, core stability and power.
results.name: Scottish Smallsword & Broadsword

results.description:
"A universal theology is impossible, but a universal experience is not only possible but necessary. It is this experience toward which the course is directed." (ACIM Manual for Teachers)

Designed to correct perception and lead to a universal experience of knowledge, A Course In Miracles has been translated into 23 languages, is referenced and utilized by many of today's most reknowned spiritual teachers, and has inspired countless books and curriculums based on its teachings. But it can be a difficult book to grasp. It is lengthy, the writing is abstract, and its use of Christian terminology alienates many.

And yet it has become one of the most influential spiritual books of today. Join us as we dive into it, and are led to understand its principles against the backdrop of our own personal experiences and insights. Beginner as well as advanced Course students are welcome. We'll start with a short meditation, and then use a reading from the Course as an entry point into our time together. Cost $5 per person.

Bringing a copy of the book is helpful, but not necessary. Recommended (but again not necessary) is the combined volume that includes the three supplements (Clarification of Terms; Psychotherapy: Purpose, Process, and Practice; The Song of Prayer), available online from The Foundation For Inner Peace at acim.org.
results.how_to_find_us: From Concord St.: we're 4/10th's of a mile down Russell St. on the right, the driveway after Fraser Farm.
results.name: Join us as we discuss A Course In Miracles and apply its principles to our lives

results.description:
Please come to Ryles Jazz Club Inman Square in Cambridge, MA on Thursday evening September the 10th, to help Bees Deluxe celebrate the release of their new CD! All those who attend will receive a free copy of the CD!  If you've never  heard of Bees Deluxe here's some background. 

                  photo by Rich Hall. 

Bees Deluxe is a full-tilt, acid blues/funk/rock collective comprised of Boston-based musicians. Their unique repertoire includes over three sets of originals and 60s, 70s, and 80s covers from Billie Holiday, Miles Davis, Joe Zawinul, Charles Mingus, B.B. King, Kenny Burrell, Freddie King, Herbie Hancock, Albert King, Etta James, Muddy Waters, The Meters, Little Feat, Ray Charles, Jimi Hendrix, Roy Buchanan, Curtis Mayfield, The Butterfield Blues Band, Derek Trucks, Donny Hathaway, Amy Winehouse, Steely Dan, Etta James, ZZ Top, Robben Ford, Bonnie Raitt, Bobby 'Blue' Bland, SoulLive, Derek and the Dominoes, Robert Cray, Edgar Winter, Amy Winehouse, among many others. Taking the road less traveled, they discover and share off-the-beaten songs and instrumentals and fuse them into their own original works. They dare to be risk-takers on stage, digging deep into the vaults of blues/jazz antiquity. The result is an effortless take no-prisoners-approach that wittingly captures the audience's hearts. 


Advance tickets can be purchased online via Ryles TIcket Agency here. 

Here are a few press clips about the band: 

what an incredible voyage it was. One to be taken over and over, each time revealing some new nuance in this mind enriching musical gem. 
— Greg "Bluesdog" Szalony, Boston Blues Magazine 

Bees Deluxe, effortlessly incorporates American blues, R&B, British Invasion and soul in to a hearty amalgam of guitar driven rock & roll that shakes and stirs. 
— Brian Owens, Metronome Magazine 

unquestionably unique; acid blues at its finest, dripping with virtuosity 
— A J Wachtel, Boston Blues Society 

I have to recommend Bees Deluxe to music enthusiasts who appreciate strong musicians 
— Georgetown Fats 

Bees Deluxe have found an important niche for themselves in the greater-Boston blues scene. 
— Bill Copeland, Bill Copeland Music News 

bluesy stuff. Jazz predominates, yet the blues, funk and lots of rock are there. 
— Steve Jones, President of the Crossroads Blues Society 

Please feel free to share meetup this with any friends who live near Cambridge and any friends who support local and fresh live music.

results.description:
[We will be guided through several interactive exercises to experience the deep connection we have with animals and to develop and strengthen our intuitive abilities]

We Are Animals ~ Connecting with the Medicine of All Living Things!

We are so excited to have Aria Mae join us. She will introduce a simple technique to listen to the messages of our animal guides, pets, and other natural supports.  

By understanding our power to communicate with animals, we can fundamentally shift the course of mass extinction. Communicating with animals expands all of humanity's consciousness to include dignity for other species.  

What's more, animals want to support us in this shift, and it brings them great honor to speak their wisdom and be heard by you.  

Aria will specifically lead activities focused on: 
        -Opening your heart and holding awareness of animal messages
        -Connecting with your animal guide for the evening and hearing the special wisdom they hold for you
         -Healing the deeper traumas of the animal kingdom- between humans and other species- using constellation principles

Aria carries a deep recognition of the link between people, animals, and ancestors. Come experience a new way of being in relationship with the animals surrounding you. 

To Prepare

1. If you have one, please bring photo of an animal you love- whether a present or past pet, or any animal you have held love for in your heart.

2. Feel welcome to write down any questions you have for this animal, if any come up before the workshop. 

 

Bonus

Watch this amazing short video about a profound animal communication exchange:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gvwHHMEDdT0



Our Facilitator

Aria Mae envisions a world where all living things are connected with honor. With Family Constellations training through the Seeing with Your Heart Program, along with Priestess Path and studies in Sociology, Peace, & Social Justice, she brings a rare approach to animal medicine and interspecies healing. Aria's vision is a world where we see ourselves in our truth: We Are Animals. Learn more at www.ariamae.com.

results.description:
Join us for our first dance of the season, a Barn Dance where you'll meet our renowned and incomparable caller, Bob Butler, for the first time, who'll delight and surprise you as you learn the basics of square dancing.


Please, bring your friends, your kids, your partners, or come alone. Singles are highly encouraged, as are couples, teens, children, families and adults of all ages. We want to meet you!


There is no better way to spend an evening and meet friendly people than to dance with them, as our caller both humors and challenges us.


We expect you'll have the best time you've had in months. People with no experience are welcomed for two more weeks before our regular classes begin advancing through the rest of the Basic and Mainstream program.


So, come to this opening night! We expect a big crowd. And see what we're like! Perhaps, you'll want to come back and join us on Thursdays from 7-9:30 PM. Dances and classes cost $7 per adult, $3 for young people 10-16 yrs.


When complete, you'll be able to dance at all local and club dances in the area. You'll be seeing and doing something that looks a lot like this.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I4lxfXltCxQ

Visit our website if you want to learn more about us.

results.description:
Itadaki downstairs bar (Boston, Newbury St. between Gloucester and Fairfield) 7 pm to 10 pm

Join me at this izakaya style venue for a pleasant evening of drinks, food and chats. Whether you're learning Japanese or English, buy a drink, join the table, and practice your new language in a friendly and relaxed environment. If you're a beginner or just interested in culture, you'll fit in fine! Don't miss out on this opportunity to learn and practice over a few drinks. Can't make it on time? Need to leave early? Not a problem. Just stop by if you can!

If you are >21 and plan to drink, please bring a MA state issued ID or passport. Other state IDs may not be accepted. Please order at the bar and take care of your own tab.

Transportation: I highly recommend using public transportation. Not only is driving while intoxicated dangerous, but there may not be any parking available in the area. A lot of the parking on Newbury St  is Residential Only in the evenings, and many of the signs indicating this are very well hidden. If you insist on parking in the area, be aware that meter maids love handing out parking tickets around here. Best methods for public transportation are the green line subway or bus #1 to the Hynes stop.

I have made an arrangements with the Itadaki staff for a simpler ordering method. Last time was very chaotic and stressful for the bartender, so lets do our best to not confuse the bartender. :)

Ordering at Itadaki

1) Order your first drink at the bar. If it's alcoholic, your ID will be checked at this time. You will also be  given a guest number to use the rest of the night.

2) If you're at a table, the bartender will try to make several rounds throughout the night to take additional orders. Keep using your guest number and please feel free to order more food and drinks.

3) Keep in mind we're a pretty large group so don't be offended or annoyed with the bartender if he doesn't get to you right away. If you have an urgent order, go request it at the bar.

4) Please take care of your tab and don't forget to tip*. The management and staff are doing a lot to make this all possible.

*Note: If the group is large, an 18% tip may already be included.

See you there!
~Lindsay
results.how_to_find_us: Go to the downstairs bar and look for the sign!

results.description:
I wanted to do another set of documentaries about genocide and then realized I would have a string of meetups about genocide, abortion and discrimination so I am doing something more light-hearted to break it up! 

Be absorbed in the color and energy of these Aussie flicks. Let's discuss Baz Luhrmann's "Strictly Ballroom" (1992) & Stephan Elliot's "The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert" (1994). Both films are full of quirkiness, color and music. 

Interesting note: Strictly Ballrooom was actually studied by scientists to reveal how the brain processes color! Crazy talk! http://www.dailytelegraph.com.au/lifestyle/analysis-of-strictly-ballroom-leads-to-colourful-conclusions/story-e6frf00i-1225940896638 

Accessing the movies: Strictly Ballroom is on Netflix stream or can be rented on Amazon Prime for $2.99. The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert can be streamed on Hulu or rented on Amazon Prime for $2.99.

No worries about the documentaries we will still discuss them later!
results.name: Aussie Flicks! Strictly Ballroom & Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert

results.description:
Ongoing class in Medieval and Renaissance Longsword in the tradition of Johannes Lichtenauer.


The Longsword is the iconic fantasy Knight's sword - a two-handed, straight blade with a cross guard. The weapon may seem to be simple at first but is in reality a weapon of finesse and skill.


The class covers all the basics of footwork, attacks and defenses. Drills are developed from simple to complex; from rigidly choreographed to open-ended. Timing, distance and judgement are developed.


All classes begin with a Strength & Conditioning program designed to physically prepare one for fighting with the sword. Elements develop agility, core stability and power.
results.name: German Longsword

results.description:
The Amateur Telescope Makers of Boston, Inc. (ATMoB) is an amateur astronomy club devoted to telescope making, observing, and studying the heavens. The ATMoB was founded in 1934 with the cooperation of Dr. Harlow Shapley at Harvard College Observatory. In 1973, the Bond Astronomical Society, another long-standing club, merged with the ATMoB making the club one of the oldest and largest general interest astronomy clubs in the country.

The mission of the ATMoB is to engage in, to encourage others to engage in, and to provide instruction and facilities for the design, construction and use of telescopes and other astronomical instruments, and in general to promote interest in amateur observational astronomy and the instruments used therefore.

We meet formally the second Thursday of every month (except August) to hear a speaker, to discuss club activities, and to socialize. Past speakers include Phillip Morrison, Owen Gingrich, David Malin, Brian Marsden, and many others.

Topic TBD


Professor TBD

(Technical Support: <a>[masked]</a>)


The Inner Engineering online program includes guided meditations, powerful breathing techniques, and deeply engaging discourses about the nature of the mind and practical wisdom to manage life’s situations.

Inner Engineering is a combination of methods derived from the ancient science of yoga that addresses every aspect of human well-being — from your body, mind and emotions to the essential life energy within.

This 1 hour introduction to Inner Engineering explains the fundamental approach of the program in a live setting that offers you the opportunity to ask a trained Isha teacher questions about the program and practices available.

“Inner Engineering is neither a religion, nor a philosophy or dogma; It is a technology for wellbeing. One does not have to believe or disbelieve, you just have to learn to use it. Technology will produce results irrespective of who you are.” – Sadhguru

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball.

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.
results.name: Friday Lunchtime Soccer (OUTDOOR)

results.description:
WebRTC is a rapidly developing movement bringing real time communications to the web and native apps with just a few standardized, opens source web API’s

Friday 11th September, the WebRTC Boston and the New England Software Engineers meetup will meet to view and discuss a live video feed for a top-notch WebRTC event at Google's offices in San Francisco. We’ll meet at 2:30 PM to be ready for the YouTube broadcast that will start at 3:00 PM, during the event coffee, snacks and sodas will be provided by McGraw Hill education. Please visit http://krankygeek.com for more info about the video feed.

What will you learn?

Highlights include:

• Updates from major browser vendors - Google, Mozilla, and Microsoft

• Working with WebRTC in native mobile environments

• Best practices for UX, reliability, security, and DataChannel use

• What’s next for WebRTC

• Reviews of various WebRTC use cases by actual implementers

The event has a great mix of speakers from Google, Twilio, Atlassian, IBM and Mozilla as well participation by Microsoft and cutting-edge start-ups.  After some brief technology introductions, we will have several in-depth technical sessions with practical speakers to provide basic and intermediate technical education for working with WebRTC.
results.name: Realtime feed for Kranky Geek WebRTC Live Event

results.description:
Leonard Cassuto discusses The Graduate School Mess: What Caused It and How We Can Fix It

This event is free and includes a book signing; no tickets are required.

Friday, September 11,[masked]pm

Harvard Book Store

1256 Massachusetts Ave., Cambridge

Harvard Book Store welcomes Chronicle of Higher Education columnist LEONARD CASSUTO for a discussion of his book The Graduate School Mess: What Caused It and How We Can Fix It. 

It is no secret that American graduate education is in disarray. Graduate students take too long to complete their studies and face a dismal academic job market if they succeed. The Graduate School Mess gets to the root of these problems and offers concrete solutions for revitalizing graduate education in the humanities. Leonard Cassuto argues that universities’ heavy emphasis on research comes at the expense of teaching. But teaching is where reforming graduate school must begin. 

Cassuto says that graduate education must recover its mission of public service. Professors should revamp the graduate curriculum and broaden its narrow definition of success to allow students to create more fulfilling lives for themselves both inside and outside the academy. Cassuto frames the current situation foremost as a teaching problem: professors rarely prepare graduate students for the demands of the working worlds they will actually join. He gives practical advice about how faculty can teach and advise graduate students by committing to a student-centered approach.In chapters that follow the career of the graduate student from admissions to the dissertation and placement, Cassuto considers how each stage of graduate education is shaped by unexamined assumptions and ancient prejudices that need to be critically confronted. Written with verve and infused with history, The Graduate School Mess returns our national conversation about graduate study in the humanities to first principles. 

Event Series: Friday Forum 

Harvard Book Store's Friday Forum series takes place on Friday afternoons during the academic year as a way to highlight scholarly books in a wide range of fields, with a particular focus on local scholars. Friday Forums take place at 3pm in Harvard Book Store. 

Purchase the Book: Featured event books will be for sale at the event for 20% off. Thank you for supporting this author series with your purchases.

General Info: (617)[masked] - [masked] 

Media Inquiries: (617)[masked] x1 - [masked] 

Accessibility Inquiries: [masked]

Our group has been invited to the Open House and BBQ for a new project in Chelsea's Admiral's Hill, right on the river called '305 Microlofts at Commoncove'. It's 9 new micro-loft condos with great flexible-space and beautiful water/city views. They are hoping to redefine the real estate market in the greater Boston area by opening the eyes of home buyers to the potential to resize their lives, and realize that they don't need to pay for these huge spaces in order to have everything they need... 

For more information on the project, please check out their website: <a>www.305microlofts.com.</a> They are also on Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, and Twitter. Here's an article that Curbed Boston's tiny-home enthusiast Tom Acitelli wrote about the project:

http://boston.curbed.com/archives/2015/06/chelsea-micro-lofts-commandants-way.php

As this is a fairly new concept for the area, they would be interested in hearing what the group members think of this project. 

It's a neat area with a co-working space (http://commoncove.com/) and nearby is Mystic Brewery with a fabulous beer selection and great, interesting space, as well. http://www.mystic-brewery.com/wordpress/

results.description:
We often struggle to work with the trauma that is so present in our lives. We are bombarded and overwhelmed with a world that seems to be falling part. We are confronted with the concerns about our natural environment as well as social problems such as racism, poverty, war, violence, and a host of other things. We are left with a trauma that is unexamined and which affects the quality of our lives and our interpersonal interactions. How do we begin to work with this kind of trauma in our personal experience and within our Sanghas with the help of our dharma practice? How can we cultivate the space, willingness, and courage to authentically show up with our woundedness within a safe space in order to heal? Please join us for a special evening of practice as we explore the frontiers of healing our community based trauma through the dharma.

This event is one of the First Friday Evening Practice for
People of Color evenings.   For the September meeting all are welcome and invited.
results.name: Healing through the Dharma

results.description:
The Story of Me is a film which is screening as part of the Brazilian Independence Festival.

The Brazilian Women's Group graciously welcomed nearly fifteen of us at last year's great film..

Spoken in Portuguese with subtitles in English, FREE  and open to the public.

Please answer if you want to get together for dinner after the film.

Members of the Portuguese Meetup will also be joining us.

Check out <a>MBTA</a> or Hop Stop to create your route by public transit.

Directed by Luís Villaça (2009), the story takes place in the 1970’s, in the city of Belo Horizonte, where Roberto Carlos Ramos lives in the slums with his mother and nine siblings. His mother takes him to Febem (a juvenile correction center), believing that the system would give him the chance for a better life. At the institution, Roberto Carlos uses his creativity to obtain food and attention, and also learns how to influence his peers. When he becomes an adolescent, he is transferred to another institution where the rules are stricter. To escape physical punishment, Roberto Carlos and other boys discover the world or drugs and petty theft, running away every time he has the opportunity to do so. His behavior is defined as irrecoverable by the institution. At that point in his life, he meets the french educator Margherit Duvas, who, with extreme kindness, will slowly gain the affection of that troubled young man. She adopts him and he finally has the chance to learn how to read and write, and he sets his creative energy free when he becomes a student. They both relocate to France. After finishing his studies, Roberto Carlos returns to his hometown and goes back to Febem as an educator, starting his story with other children and adolescents whom he adopts and bring together as a big and happy family. He has now twenty adopted children, some of whom were deemed “irrecoverable” by the institution, the same way as he had been once.

Spoken in Portuguese with subtitles in English, FREE and open to the public.
results.name: Brazilian Film Screening Friday September 11th

results.description:
Do you long for connection?

Not just a conversation or sex.

But real connection?


You Are Not Alone

Many people have a deep longing for this form of connection, but without the vocabulary to discuss it or the tools to create it, this longing goes unfulfilled.

Fulfill Your Desires

But there is hope!  In this weekend workshop, masters of sex and intimacy, Kelle Sparta will walk you through the process of getting into your body, connecting with yourself, and finding union with another.

Hands-on, Clothing-on Workshop

In this introduction to the world of sacred sexuality:

• You’ll discover how to let another in.

• You’ll learn how to share yourself more fully.

• How to speak your “yes” and your “no”.

• And you’ll learn how to create that connection you desire anytime you want.

Removing The Barriers To Connection

So many things can get in the way of your ability to connect.  We’ll work on issues of:

• Body Image

• Control

• Performance Anxiety

• Safety

• Vulnerability

• Ability to Receive Love and Affection

• Staying in Your Body and Out of Your Head

Join us for this ecstatic experiential journey into connection


Who Should Come

This program is ideal for:

• Beginners just getting their feet wet in the pool of ecstatic intimacy, Tantra, and sacred sexuality.  

• Spiritual seekers looking to improve their ability to be present, to open their hearts, and to receive.

Anyone looking to nourish their spirit with a weekend of bliss and connection.


The Art of Ecstatic Intimacy 
September 11-13, 2015

Singles $395 Early Bird Registration $350 (until Aug 31) 

Couples $650 Early Bird Registration $600 (until Aug 31)

Singles and couples are welcome.  LGBTQ welcome – call Kelle for more info[masked]-6257.  Singles who register with a gender balance (person of the opposite sex) will get the couples rate.

About Your Instructor

Kelle Sparta is a Transformational Shaman, Dakini, and Tantrika who revels in taking people into ecstatic states of consciousness and showing them how to stay there. From this place of consciousness, she says, you can find yourself most clearly.  At the core of her work in the world is the discovery and mastery of personal power and self-love for each person she works with.  She is a psychic, a medium, a channel, and an energy healer.  Kelle’s work is all around empowering you to choose the life YOU want to lead.  www.KelleSparta.com

results.description: AWAKE: The Life of Yogananda is an unconventional biography about the Hindu Swami who brought yoga and meditation to the West in the 1920s. Paramahansa Yogananda authored the spiritual classic Autobiography of a Yogi, which has sold millions of copies worldwide and is a go-to book for seekers, philosophers and yoga enthusiasts today. By personalizing his own quest for enlightenment and sharing his struggles along the path, Yogananda made ancient Vedic teachings accessible to a modern audience, attracting many followers and inspiring the millions who practice yoga today. Filmed over three years with the participation of 30 countries around the world, the documentary examines the world of yoga, modern and ancient, east and west and explores why millions today have turned their attention inwards, bucking the limitations of the material world in pursuit of self-realization. The movie has received rave reviews throughout the world.
results.name: Movie Night: AWAKE- The Life of Yogananda

venue.name: Harvard Film Archive

results.description:
“I tried to film what was going on around me and value it as much as the heroics of the big screen.”—Saul Levine

With a monumental filmography that dates back almost fifty years and seems to grow monthly (if not weekly), Saul Levine (b. 1943) long ago established himself as a central figure in American experimental cinema. He is also a key member of the filmmaking community in Boston and Cambridge, not only because of his own work but also for his passionate, tireless and inspiring roles as both a professor at the Massachusetts College of Art and Design and the programmer of the MassArt Film Society, one of the foremost venues for experimental cinema in the area. The Harvard Film Archive is extremely excited to present the first in a number of programs designed to help local audiences acquaint, or re-acquaint, themselves with Levine’s impressive body of work, from the beginnings to the present day.

The films in this program, and their juxtaposition, show the ways in which Levine’s work interweaves the personal and the political, combining intimacy with public activism.

Saul’s Scarf

US[masked], 16mm, color, 20 min

Lost Note

US[masked], 16mm, color & b/w, 10 min

The Big Stick/An Old Reel

US[masked], 16mm, b/w, 10 min

New Left Note

US[masked], 16mm, color & b/w, 28 min


With the Director Present, we will not schedule a formal discussion following the films.  However, folks may want to go to a nearby drinkereatery for post-experience discussion.  

We will plan to meetup at Grafton Street Pub starting as early as 5:15 for pre-film dinner and discussion.

results.description:
Following the great success of our well attended and enjoyable critique night we are offering it again!

bring along up to three images on a thumb drive or CD/DVD and have them anonymously and constructively  critiqued by Ian and the group.

Having your images critiqued is a great way to improve your photography.  Knowing how others see your wonderful images can be very informative and challenging. The anonymity of this process ensures that you will not feel embarrassed, and of course if the image receives rave reviews you can always claim it as yours :-)

Just as important as having your images critiqued is learning how to look at and critique the images of others. 

The session will run from 7.30pm until 10pm and is just $25 (but there is a limit on numbers so RSVPing is essential.
