The Minuteman Bikeway passes through the historic area where the American Revolution began in April 1775.

Today, the Minuteman Bikeway is one of the most popular and successful rail-trails in the United States, enjoyed for both healthy recreation and transportation.

The bikeway has become a new type of “Main Street” where neighbors and strangers alike come together while riding, walking, or skating on the path.

In 2008, Rails-to-Trails Conservancy inducted the Minuteman Bikeway into the national Rail-Trail Hall of Fame.

results.description:
These sessions at The Chinatown Community Center/Josia School will focus on a 6 week rotating schedule of classes designed to introduce the basics of Parkour in concentrate classes. The schedule will follow in order: 

• Safety, Landings and Balance

Class 1 will be focusing on how to land, move and stay safe practicing Parkour outdoor and in the real world. 

• Vaulting

Class 2 will focus on the foundation of Parkour - getting over low-level obstacles fast and efficiently through the use of vaulting.

• Precisions

Class 3 will focus on accuracy of jumping and foot/eye coordination honing basic standing and running jumps.

• Wall Techniques 

Class 4 will focus on conquering obstacles too large or tall to vault, in tandem with using walls as a means to keep a more efficient run.

• Tumbling/Acro

Class 5 focus is on tumbling and acrobatic skills, in pursuit of fully understanding movement in a 3D space and total proprioception.

• Flow + Speed

Class 6 links together all the previous lessons into one cohesive movement, and a timed obstacle course setting. ------

What if I've never done anything like Parkour before? 


This class, Parkour 101, is a introductory level class. We will be focusing more on learning how to move our body, understand our limits and get a solid understanding of how to train safe rather than jumping straight into super-high level flips and jumps. 

What if I'm a gymnast/marine/stuntman/etc? I don't want to be bored.

Our program prides itself on scaling classes to each and every student. With something like Parkour there are many levels and progressions to each movement. It's very common to in the same class have one student working on perfecting their roll, and on the other side of the room have another student practicing very high-level acrobatics. They both come from the same foundation, but are scaled to each practitioners skill level. 

What do I need to bring/prepare?

The great thing about Parkour is its accessibility. You really only need a good pair of shoes. We recommend a shoe that is made for urban running (no aggressive treads, a smoother sole lightweight). Think hiking boots, crocs, skate shoes are all no-nos. 

Other than that, dress appropriately for activity. Shorts, sweats, t-shirts are all good here. Jeans are normally not the best choice. 

We highly recommend bringing water, snacks and a form of transportation (bike, longboard, potentially train fare)

We will be charging a $5 per class fee to start here, and for the 1 hour 15 minute class we think this isn't too ridiculous. We accept cash or card day of. 

Anything else?

These jams will be run outdoors, and with existing architecture. While we won't be getting into anything crazy, injuries are to be expected. Scrapes happen. We will have first aid available, but make sure you are thinking clearly and in your limits before training! 

I am available to answer all questions, but I hope to see a whole bunch of you out in a few weeks!! 

Be sure to check us out on:

https://www.facebook.com/ParkourAndTricking

https://instagram.com/projectfreerun


http://www.projectfreerun.com/
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be on the main courtyard up the stairs. The location itself is of concrete construction, and has yellow rails!

results.description:
The 23rd annual Cambridge Carnival is being held on Sunday, September 13. This is a great opportunity to shoot elaborately costumed dancers as they parade from near the Whole Foods Market on River St. to Kendall Sq. where there will be performances, food, vendors and the like.

I suggest we meet at Riverside Press Park at the corner of Blackstone & River Streets, where the participants gather to put on their costumes and start the parade. I find this offers a much better shooting opportunity than the parade itself as you can get some good candid shots as well as ask individuals to move around for you to get them in better light, minimize distracting backgrounds, etc. As with most costumed events, these folks are pleased as punch to have their pictures taken so don't be shy about walking up to someone and asking!

The parade is scheduled to start at 12:30 but they often start late (Island Time don't you know). Lets meet an hour earlier (11:30) so we have plenty of time to catch them in the marshaling area. We can then follow the parade down River St., through Central Sq. and end up at Kendall for the afternoon.

My only two suggestions are to bring an off camera speedlight to tame harsh shadows on faces and earplugs to save your hearing from the window rattling sound trucks.
results.name: Cambridge Carnival International

results.description:
Come and join us for open board gaming at Excelsior!  They have a large gaming area to seat approximately 50 gamers in addition to a growing board game library that patrons may take right off the library shelf and play at-will.  They have also dedicated their Sunday schedule for just this open board gaming event, so us board gamers will have the pick of the tables during the entirety of the event which happens to run the entire time the shop is open on Sundays.

Attendees are welcome to bring in their own games or use games from the library.  Bobby will also run game demos during the event in case you want to learn a new game or simply try before you buy.

In case you are interested in purchasing the game from the demo session, Excelsior will offer 10% off the price of purchasing a new copy of that game that day on top of the 10% discount they are offer to all MBG members (for a total discount of 20% off).  If for some reason they are out of stock of the demo game and must special order it for you that day, they will order it for you and allow you to take an additional 10% special order discount on top of the previous two discounts for a total discount of 30% off!

Want to special order something that is not the demo game?  Add the base TGA 10% discount and the 10% special order discount together for a total of 20% off any special orders.

Nourishment:  The shop carries various snacks and non-alcoholic beverages if you need something to snack or sip on while you game.  For more substantial food, there are many eateries located within walking distance from the shop on Main Street.

Parking:  Excelsior has an agreement in place with the Jiffy Lube at 3 Powder Mill Road.  Attendees may park in the lot behind the Jiffy Lube building.  From there, it is a short walk across Powder Mill Road to the Excelsior's door on the corner of Powder Mill and Waltham Street, which is the 4-way intersection closest to Jiffy Lube.
results.how_to_find_us: On the corner of Waltham Street and Powder Mill Road, park behind the Jiffy Lube

results.description:
(Animal wines = wines with a picture of an animal on the label)

***Please be sure to read the HOW TO SIGN UP section***

The success of the Boston Blind Wine Tasters Meetup depends on those generous people who are willing to host a tasting - in their home or in an alternate venue (think BYOB restaurants and other open-to-the public places).  As a big THANK YOU to anyone who posts an event in August, September or October, hosts (who are welcome to bring a +1 either from within or without the BBWT group) are exclusively invited to attend:

The Thirteenth Annual "Polo In the Country" polo match between the Norfolk and Dedham teams, which will take place on Sunday September 13, 2015 at the Norfolk Hunt Steeplechase Course in Medfield, MA.  Gates open at 11 am - let's all be there by noon.  The match begins at 1 pm.  I will purchase tailgate space and we can enjoy wine and picnic food together while watching this fun and entertaining program. I have a tent, table, and some chairs but  you may want to bring a chair, too.


The event, presented by the Norfolk Hunt Club, raises funds for the preservation and protection of 100 acres of recreational space in Medfield, Dover, Sherborn and the surrounding communities. Please feel good about bringing  $15 per person admission fee.  The cost of the tailgate space is on me.


HOW TO SIGN UP:  If you have an event on the board in August, September or October, add yourself to the wait list (with a +1 if you like) for  Polo in the Country.  When I see it there, I will add you in as long as I haven’t reached the limit.  This will prevent my having to move people out who don't qualify and who don't read this far down into the instructions :-) 

Please be responsible for your +1 if you have one.  Kindly change your RSVP if your +1 drops, and make sure they bring a wine, a picnic item and the  $15 admission fee.


WHAT TO BRING?

Bring your favorite Wine with an Animal on the Label. 


Please spend at least $12 but feel free to bring something pricier that will wow your fellow guests.  Also bring the $15 fee, a wine glass, and some picnic nosh.  Simple, fun, funny.

WHAT TO WEAR? The only important thing is to know that this event takes place in a grassy field, so don’t wear stilettos.  Otherwise, you can go as Pretty Woman as you like.

I hope to see you there!
results.name: HOSTS INCENTIVE EVENT at POLO IN THE COUNTRY:  Animal Wines

results.description:
Our group has been invited to the Open House for a new project in Chelsea's Admiral's Hill, right on the river called '305 Microlofts at Commoncove'. It's 9 new micro-loft condos with great flexible-space and beautiful water/city views. They are hoping to redefine the real estate market in the greater Boston area by opening the eyes of home buyers to the potential to resize their lives, and realize that they don't need to pay for these huge spaces in order to have everything they need... 

For more information on the project, please check out their website: <a>www.305microlofts.com.</a> They are also on Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, and Twitter. Here's an article that Curbed Boston's tiny-home enthusiast Tom Acitelli wrote about the project:

http://boston.curbed.com/archives/2015/06/chelsea-micro-lofts-commandants-way.php 

As this is a fairly new concept for the area, they would be interested in hearing what the group members think of this project. 

It's a neat area with a co-working space (http://commoncove.com/) and nearby is Mystic Brewery with a fabulous beer selection and great, interesting space, as well. http://www.mystic-brewery.com/wordpress/
results.name: Open House: Microloft Units in Chelsea

results.description:
20th Brazilian Independence Day Festival

Sunday, September 13, 2015 - 12:00pm to 6:00pm
1175 Soldier Fields Road
02135 Boston , MA The “7 de Setembro” Organizing Committee and the Brazilian Women's Group is delighted to invite you to the 20th Brazilian Independence Day Festival, which will take place on Sunday, September 13h, 2015, from 12:00 to 6:00 p.m., at the MDC Herter Park, 1175 Soldiers Field Road (in front of TV Station – Channel 4), Brighton, Boston, Massachusetts. For 20 years the Brazilian Independence Day Festival has been an annual highlight of the community. It is the largest Brazilian cultural event in New England, attracting crowds of over 7,000 people. This is an ideal opportunity to promote your goods and services to the Brazilian community. As in previous years, the 2015 Festival will feature children’s activities, information tables, arts and crafts, ethnic food, live Brazilian music, and many other attractions. Music performances begin at 1:00 p.m. All of the events are free and wheelchair accessible. For this 20th anniversary of the Festival we are working to make this year better than ever! This is possible with your participation. We count on your presence to promote your products and services to the Brazilian community and beyond, and to help in promoting the Festival. For community organizations and crafts the fee for one table is $40. This price includes a tablecloth and two chairs. All other objects/equipment must be approved ahead of time by the festival organizing committee. To reserve your table, please fill out and sign the contract and return it to us by Friday, August 21, 2015 together with your payment. Donations are welcome. Please keep a copy of the contract for your personal records. For more information on how to sponsor the Festival or to place an ad for your business in our adbook, call 617-[masked] or visit our website at www.verdeamarelo.org/festival (link is external). Your participation is what makes this event a success. We look forward to seeing you at the 20th Brazilian Independence Day Festival in Boston! For more information, contact [masked] (link sends e-mail)

results.description:
International Stage2015 International Stage Performers (Corner of Ames Street & Main Street):

Featuring DJ Natty Kool

JAH-N-I Roots Band (Reggae)

Hot Like Fire (Soca, Calypso, Reggae)

Kizomba Konpa (Haitian Compa )

King Ilabash and Reggae Connection Sound Band (Dance Hall/Lovers Rock)

—–

King Ilabash – Dance Hall/Lovers Rock

</a>

Hailing from St. George’s, Grenada, King Ilabash, has worked hard over the years to achieve recognition in the music industry and to earn the admiration and respect of fans and fellow musicians alike setting his own foundation as the Dancehall King.  With his smooth reggae vocals, down home attitude, and cross-genre musical style, King Ilabash displays a realness and originality that is all too rare in the world of reggae music.This island boy is a triple threat: song writer, artist, and dj.  As a song writer, this lyrical genius doesn’t follow a specific songwriting formula or focus on one particular message or vibe.  Instead, each song reflects a different experience within the greater context of King’s story.  As an artist, his signature is a well choreographed vocal style that features smooth reggae verses, infectious melodic hooks and intricate soulful harmonies.  The King brings his own technique and personality to the stage with lyrics that touch on a wide variety of subjects in which his listeners can relate. As a dj, for over twelve years, King has the ability to move the masses. He has played at countless premier events throughout the east coast.See more at <a href="http://www.kingilabash.com/">www.kingilabash.com. JAH-N-I Roots Band 

</a>

JAH-N-I Roots Band is a world-renowned reggae, roots & culture band that utilizes it’s versatility and talent to continue to spread the positive, conscious messages that are necessary in today’s society – with a customized delivery that caters to the listeners of this day and age. JAH-N-I Roots Band is committed to spreading the conscious messages of peace, love and unity to the masses around the world. Jahriffe’s passion for seeking truth and wisdom has been combined to inspire and create the soulfully artistic delivery of The JAH-N-I Roots Band (pronounced JAH IN I). Hailing as the lead vocalist in one of Boston’s finest, past and present; the award winning JAH-N-I Roots Band has made a permanent mark in the genre of roots reggae, with a melodic R&B soul twist for the past twelve years. JAH-N-IRoots Band was formed in 2001 and released their first album in 2005 – titled “Rastafari Love” which received huge attention from around the world, in the states and overseas in other countries such as Belgium, France and Germany – just to name a few. One of their tracks titled “Food” was also featured on a youth development program called the Citizen’s School.Through the years JAH-N-I Roots Band has been actively involved in the musical arena. Jahrifffe performed acoustically in the documentary “Discovering Rastafari” – which was displayed in the Smithsonian Museum in Washington D.C. While maintaining the humility that has held the vision of this band together over the years; JAH-N-I Roots Band has been privileged to combine the talents of Berklee music school students along with the individual contributions of the foundation and additional band members – Simon Rochester, Felix Fantasia and Derek Wood who all cultivate an expertise that allows them to share the stage with such legendary acts as Steven and Ky Mani Marley, Midnite, Anthony B, Mighty Diamonds, Freddie McGregor, Queen Ifrica and Tony Rebel. The talent and versatility of this band commands an audience presence that speaks to the style and message of the music. JAH-N-I Roots Band has been nominated for the Boston Urban Awards for Best Roots Band 2007. JAH-N-I is a roots reggae band that carries a diverse sound from players of instruments to singers of songs. This band is a great example of a melting pot of Rastafari in its true essence and its influence on the world. This is a band that would relight your wick if it were to ever go out. <a href="http://cambridgecarnival.org/entertainment/featured-performers/international-stage/www.hotlikefire.net"> Hot Like Fire

<a href="http://cambridgecarnival.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/07/HLF-20131.jpg"></a>

A sexy chick playin’ a mean horn and singin’ too?  That’s Kelley B.!  Her band, Hot Like Fire, has emerged as the most sought after, authentic reggae party band on the New England music scene for 25 years now…celebrating their 25th anniversary this year!  Winner of the 2014 New England Urban Music Award for Best Caribbean Band.  Kelley B.’s earthy voice and original sound have taken their latest release “Forward” to another level with catchy, singalong hooklines and positive messages.A native of Massachusetts and a graduate of Berklee College of Music, Kelley annually spends time performing on the island of Trinidad and throughout the Caribbean while nurturing Hot Like Fire in Boston.  They draw 600+ fans every Sunday during the Summer months at Surfside on Salisbury Beach.  New England Performer Magazine says Hot Like Fire is “energetic, upbeat, and highly addictive”.Hot Like Fire is a well-respected Boston icon…a hot, exciting and fun reggae band that always leaves it’s audience calling for more.  Just wait til you hear her blow that horn!  Yeah yeah!

results.description:
Maps of imaginary places have accompanied literature for centuries. Visualizing the fanciful worlds described in works of fiction sets the stage for events taking place in a story and often provides insight into the characters themselves.

In this exhibition of forty items, visitors will discover maps from a variety of fictional genres, learn how authors create imaginary worlds, and appreciate why descriptive geography is essential to the story. People and creatures—even those who exist only in tales—are related to place, and maps of their imaginary worlds allow readers to be transported into the geography of fantasy

Sounds good right? They even have a suggested reading list (how cool is that?)
https://bpl.bibliocommons.com/list/share/243068888_nblmc/365592878_literary_landscapes_booklist

I set the time of the event to be the entire time that the exhibit is open on Sundays. We could always meet up for lunch before or go after.

For those interested, the BPL Central Library also has another exhibit going on called " We Are One: Mapping America’s Road from Revolution to Independence"

Featuring 60 maps and 40 prints, paintings and objects, this major gallery exhibition traces the American story from the French and Indian War to the creation of a new national government and the founding of Washington, D.C. as its home.

Organized by the Norman B. Leventhal Map Center, We Are One features treasures from the Boston Public Library, the British Library, Library of Congress, and others. Highlights include rare and historically significant items that have not been previously exhibited.

Hope to see you all there!
results.name: A Day at the BPL - Literary Landscapes: Maps from Fiction &  We Are One

results.description:
Dear Meditators....want to try a meditative form of soulful art? SoulCollage® is amazingly fun, meditative and easy. Express your soul by selecting from hundred of images you glue on mat boards. Everything is supplied...snacks too!  Express your longings, your joys, your inner selves. Use metaphors like doors, paths and gateways to depict life's journies. Images of animals can show energies you have or want...strength, power, freedom in flight. Toward the end of the class we give the card a "voice" by writing down what it has to say. Many "aha" moments occur, and it's fun to see and share our cards with the group.
Come join us in this peaceful, music filled, sunlit space for the afternoon. You'll love it!
results.name: SoulCollage- a meditative form of soulful expression

results.description:
These sessions at The Chinatown Community Center/Josia School will focus on a 6 week rotating schedule of classes designed to introduce the basics of Parkour in concentrate classes. The schedule will follow in order: 

• Safety, Landings and Balance

Class 1 will be focusing on how to land, move and stay safe practicing Parkour outdoor and in the real world. 

• Vaulting

Class 2 will focus on the foundation of Parkour - getting over low-level obstacles fast and efficiently through the use of vaulting.

• Precisions

Class 3 will focus on accuracy of jumping and foot/eye coordination honing basic standing and running jumps.

• Wall Techniques 

Class 4 will focus on conquering obstacles too large or tall to vault, in tandem with using walls as a means to keep a more efficient run.

• Tumbling/Acro

Class 5 focus is on tumbling and acrobatic skills, in pursuit of fully understanding movement in a 3D space and total proprioception.

• Flow + Speed

Class 6 links together all the previous lessons into one cohesive movement, and a timed obstacle course setting.

------

What if I've never done anything like Parkour before? 


This class, Parkour 101, is a introductory level class. We will be focusing more on learning how to move our body, understand our limits and get a solid understanding of how to train safe rather than jumping straight into super-high level flips and jumps. 

What if I'm a gymnast/marine/stuntman/etc? I don't want to be bored.

Our program prides itself on scaling classes to each and every student. With something like Parkour there are many levels and progressions to each movement. It's very common to in the same class have one student working on perfecting their roll, and on the other side of the room have another student practicing very high-level acrobatics. They both come from the same foundation, but are scaled to each practitioners skill level. 

What do I need to bring/prepare?

The great thing about Parkour is its accessibility. You really only need a good pair of shoes. We recommend a shoe that is made for urban running (no aggressive treads, a smoother sole lightweight). Think hiking boots, crocs, skate shoes are all no-nos. 

Other than that, dress appropriately for activity. Shorts, sweats, t-shirts are all good here. Jeans are normally not the best choice. 

We highly recommend bringing water, snacks and a form of transportation (bike, longboard, potentially train fare)

We will be charging a $5 per class fee to start here, and for the 1 hour 15 minute class we think this isn't too ridiculous. We accept cash or card day of. 

Anything else?

These jams will be run outdoors, and with existing architecture. While we won't be getting into anything crazy, injuries are to be expected. Scrapes happen. We will have first aid available, but make sure you are thinking clearly and in your limits before training! 

I am available to answer all questions, but I hope to see a whole bunch of you out in a few weeks!! 

Be sure to check us out on:

https://www.facebook.com/ParkourAndTricking

https://instagram.com/projectfreerun


http://www.projectfreerun.com/
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be on the main courtyard up the stairs. The location itself is of concrete construction, and has yellow rails!

results.description:
It's a time for new beginnings. 

As humanists, atheists, agnostics and allies we tend to be skeptical of rituals that speak of new beginnings in life through prayer, miracles, or any kind of complete change or rebirth. Yet the need to begin again in life is something human beings share, regardless of our beliefs. 

We all need a fresh start at times: in our inner lives, our romantic and non-romantic relationships, in academics and work. Marking transitions and striving for meaningful growth may feel particularly relevant at a time of seasonal change-- especially in an era when our relationship with the climate itself needs re-thinking. What do you need to experience a new beginning in your life? Forgiveness, acceptance, trying again, understanding more deeply, committing more fully, or being more open? What do social and behavioral sciences have to say about the value of new beginnings?

For our community, this program begins our second fall season as/in the Humanist Hub, after 38 years as the Humanist Chaplaincy at Harvard. If you haven’t checked us out since back when we primarily served Harvard students, we’ve evolved significantly. This semester we’ll be hosting public programs almost every day, for hundreds of participants each week. 

Personally, Greg will mark the beginning of his second decade as Humanist Chaplain at Harvard and as our Executive Director. Join him in celebrating 10 years and let’s envision the future together! 

Join us and bring friends for this extra-special celebration, featuring a live performance from special musical guests Epic Rap Battles of History, an incredible group bringing Stephen Hawking, Bill Nye, Martin Luther King Jr., Gandhi, Donald Trump, Darth Vader, Joan of Arc, Miley Cyrus and more to hip hop battles, to the tune of over 1.8 billion views on YouTube!
results.name: Greg Epstein: New Beginnings (w/Special Guests Epic Rap Battles of History)

results.description:
Here's another chance for you to JUMP UP and DANCE in the streets. Take in the beautiful colorful sights and sway to the thumping rhythms. Want to join us at the Cambridge Carnival? Then meet up at 2 PM on the top steps of Whitehead Institute at 9 Cambridge Center (across from 500 Main Street) which is at the intersection of Main Street and Galileo Galilei Way. This is a great spot to gather and people watch.

Carnival is Rain or Shine, just like it is in the Islands and tropics.

Here's a link with the list of the food vendors, craft vendors and non-profit/community organizations.

I will be hanging out at the Brazilian Independence Day Festival on Soldiers Field Road from noon until 1:30 PM. All are welcome to join me there as well. You may call or text my cell (617)[masked] if you need help finding the group.

Check out  MBTA or  Hop Stop to create your route by public transit. Kendall Square (red line) subway station is two blocks away. After you exit the subway station, walk away from Boston (away from the river) on Main Street.

Cambridge Carnival International is a colorful and festive celebration that is rooted in African traditions. The festival, in its 23rd year, is considered a Cambridge Institution as it's the largest festival in Cambridge, attracting over 150,000 people. The highlight of the festival is a grand costume parade accompanied by rich rhythmic musicality promoting all types of cultures. Participants can be seen as revelers masquerading through the streets of Cambridge in dazzling handmade costumes dancing to the beat of Carnival. Carnival is also an opportunity to enjoy international foods, and to purchase multicultural crafts from around the world!

Schedule

12:30 - 4:00   -   Costume Parade

The parade will feature steel bands and a juried costume competition. The route spans 1.3 miles and the procession steps off at 12:30 PM at Blackstone Street and River Street, continues up to Massachusetts Avenue and on to Main Street, and ends in Kendall Square at Albany and Main Street.

FESTIVAL SITE MAP

1:00 - 6:00   -   Parade Viewing Stage - features guest DJs

Featured DJs Stage in 2014 as of 9/12/15 DJs are not posted

12:00 pm – 12:30 pm -DJ Ohh! Whistle and Bell Sound – Resident DJ

12:30 pm – 1:00 pm – DJ XRated

1:00 pm – 1:30 pm – DJ Xplosive

4:00 pm – 4:30 pm –  Jagga Movements International

4:30 pm – 5:00 pm - DJ King Terro Sound

5:00 pm – 5:30 pm - DJ Rockstonetrizz, Big City

5:30 pm – 6:00 pm - DJ Ohh! Whistle and Bell Sound – Resident DJ

International Stage Schedule features World Music, Reggae, and Soca

(Corner of Ames Street and Main Street):

12:00-12:20      Ras Takura (Dub Poetry)

12:25- 12:35      One Love Dance Group

12:45-1:30        Cheikh Ngom (African Roots)

1:45-2:30         *Nigel King Ilabash Reggae

2:45-3:30         Kizomba Konpa (Haitian Compa)

3:45-4:30         **Jah-N-I Roots Band (Reggae)

4:45-5:45        *** Hot Like Fire (Soca, Calypso, Reggae)

*King Ilabash – Dance Hall/Lovers Rock</a>

Hailing from St. George’s, Grenada, King Ilabash, has worked hard over the years to achieve recognition in the music industry and to earn the admiration and respect of fans and fellow musicians alike setting his own foundation as the Dancehall King.  With his smooth reggae vocals, down home attitude, and cross-genre musical style, King Ilabash displays a realness and originality that is all too rare in the world of reggae music.

This island boy is a triple threat: song writer, artist, and dj.  As a song writer, this lyrical genius doesn’t follow a specific songwriting formula or focus on one particular message or vibe.  Instead, each song reflects a different experience within the greater context of King’s story.  As an artist, his signature is a well choreographed vocal style that features smooth reggae verses, infectious melodic hooks and intricate soulful harmonies.  The King brings his own technique and personality to the stage with lyrics that touch on a wide variety of subjects in which his listeners can relate. As a dj, for over twelve years, King has the ability to move the masses. He has played at countless premier events throughout the east coast.See more at www.kingilabash.com.

** JAH-N-I Roots Band<a href="http://cambridgecarnival.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/07/band-1-w.jpg"></a>

JAH-N-I Roots Band is a world-renowned reggae, roots & culture band that utilizes it’s versatility and talent to continue to spread the positive, conscious messages that are necessary in today’s society – with a customized delivery that caters to the listeners of this day and age. JAH-N-I Roots Band is committed to spreading the conscious messages of peace, love and unity to the masses around the world. Jahriffe’s passion for seeking truth and wisdom has been combined to inspire and create the soulfully artistic delivery of The JAH-N-I Roots Band (pronounced JAH IN I). Hailing as the lead vocalist in one of Boston’s finest, past and present; the award winning JAH-N-I Roots Band has made a permanent mark in the genre of roots reggae, with a melodic R&B soul twist for the past twelve years. JAH-N-IRoots Band was formed in 2001 and released their first album in 2005 – titled “Rastafari Love” which received huge attention from around the world, in the states and overseas in other countries such as Belgium, France and Germany – just to name a few. One of their tracks titled “Food” was also featured on a youth development program called the Citizen’s School.

Through the years JAH-N-I Roots Band has been actively involved in the musical arena. Jahrifffe performed acoustically in the documentary “Discovering Rastafari” – which was displayed in the Smithsonian Museum in Washington D.C. While maintaining the humility that has held the vision of this band together over the years; JAH-N-I Roots Band has been privileged to combine the talents of Berklee music school students along with the individual contributions of the foundation and additional band members – Simon Rochester, Felix Fantasia and Derek Wood who all cultivate an expertise that allows them to share the stage with such legendary acts as Steven and Ky Mani Marley, Midnite, Anthony B, Mighty Diamonds, Freddie McGregor, Queen Ifrica and Tony Rebel. The talent and versatility of this band commands an audience presence that speaks to the style and message of the music.

JAH-N-I Roots Band has been nominated for the Boston Urban Awards for Best Roots Band 2007. JAH-N-I is a roots reggae band that carries a diverse sound from players of instruments to singers of songs. This band is a great example of a melting pot of Rastafari in its true essence and its influence on the world. This is a band that would relight your wick if it were to ever go out.

*** Hot Like Fire

<a href="http://cambridgecarnival.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/07/HLF-20131.jpg"></a>

<a href="http://cambridgecarnival.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/07/HLF-20131.jpg"></a>

<a href="http://cambridgecarnival.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/07/HLF-20131.jpg"></a>

<a href="http://cambridgecarnival.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/07/HLF-20131.jpg"></a>

A sexy chick playin’ a mean horn and singin’ too?  That’s Kelley B.!  Her band, Hot Like Fire, has emerged as the most sought after, authentic reggae party band on the New England music scene for 25 years now…celebrating their 25th anniversary this year!  Winner of the 2014 New England Urban Music Award for Best Caribbean Band.  Kelley B.’s earthy voice and original sound have taken their latest release “Forward” to another level with catchy, singalong hooklines and positive messages.A native of Massachusetts and a graduate of Berklee College of Music, Kelley annually spends time performing on the island of Trinidad and throughout the Caribbean while nurturing Hot Like Fire in Boston.  They draw 600+ fans every Sunday during the Summer months at Surfside on Salisbury Beach.  New England Performer Magazine says Hot Like Fire is “energetic, upbeat, and highly addictive”.Hot Like Fire is a well-respected Boston icon…a hot, exciting and fun reggae band that always leaves it’s audience calling for more.  Just wait til you hear her blow that horn!  Yeah yeah!

This is lower cost class taught by a newer teacher with the goal of making yoga affordable to all. Great for those NEW to yoga!

Arrive 10 minutes before the start time of the class. It is not fashionable to be late to yoga.

Bring a towel and a water bottle - we have free filtered water so fill 'er up.

We have FREE mats to borrow or Bring Your Own.

Wear Comfortable Work Out Clothes - Be Prepared to Sweat!

Beginners Welcome to ALL CLASSES! We offer a laid back, friendly approach to yoga.

Our classes are HEATED to about 85 to 90 degrees

results.description:
YOU ARE INVITED TO A STAGED READING OF "BERNINI IN ECSTASY," A new play in two acts by Clay Ballard. FREE ADMISSION.


BERNINI IN ECSTASY is a portrait of one of our greatest artists, the sculptor, architect, painter and playwright Gian Lorenzo Bernini (1598 — 1680). In his lifetime, the tempestuous, ambitious Bernini was both a legend and a scandal to the Romans; yet he became the intimate of eight popes. This play follows Bernini from the lowest moment of his career to the creation of his most famous statue, the Ecstasy of Saint Teresa. Against the backdrop of Baroque Rome and the Catholic Church in the Age of Absolutism, BERNINI IN ECSTASY presents the mythic personalities who inhabited this rarefied world at a critical time in history and portrays these great figures in all their humanity. BERNINI IN ECSTASY is more than a history play; it's more than a religious play or a play about power; it's more than a play about patronage or sexuality or the role of women. BERNINI IN ECSTASY illuminates the perennial struggle between art and commerce, between spiritual inspiration and religious dogma, between the spirit and the flesh; and in doing so, it deepens our understanding of the world today.

This is a staged reading of BERNINI IN ECSTASY by professional actors. It will last about 2 hours, with one intermission, to be followed by a conversation between the audience, the playwright, and the director.

at THE DANTE ALIGHIERI SOCIETY

41 Hampshire St

(Kendall Square, 2 blocks from Kendall Square Cinema), Cambridge, MA 02139,[masked]

SUNDAY, SEPTEMBER 13, 2015

from 3:00 pm to (approx.) 5:30 pm. For further info: Franco Mormando ([masked];[masked]).

(Director: Kate Caffrey. Producer: Phil Micali. Historical consultant: Franco Mormando.)

Sponsored by the Nicholas J. Sottile Fund for Italian Studies, Boston College

results.name: See a Reading of the play "Bernini in Ecstacy"

results.description:
My house is almost at the fork where Franklin Street joins Nahant Street. It's a blue duplex with a porch in the front and the American flag hanging over it. Please keep in mind that I share my driveway with my neighbor, so parking in the driveway is limited. I'll put my car in the garage, and my husband plans to make himself scarce for "my" Sunday afternoons, so there should be a couple of parking spaces in the driveway; but please park as far to the side as you can, so my neighbor can get in and out. There is parking on one side of my street, and on the surrounding streets, so you should not have any problems finding a spot. I have scheduled several meetings automatically, every two weeks, on Sundays, 3 to 5 pm. If I have to cancel a meet up for any reason (family matters and such), I will let everyone know at least a few days in advance.

I am very happy to have such a large, and growing, group, and I look forward very much to meeting everyone.

SEE YOU ALL ON SUNDAY, JUNE 07, at 3 PM!

***REGISTRATION closes 45 minutes prior to the webcast.***  Please make sure you sign-up on our website at least 45 mins prior to the webcast to receive your live log-in link via email.


(Technical Support: <a>[masked]</a>)


The Inner Engineering online program includes guided meditations, powerful breathing techniques, and deeply engaging discourses about the nature of the mind and practical wisdom to manage life’s situations.

Inner Engineering is a combination of methods derived from the ancient science of yoga that addresses every aspect of human well-being — from your body, mind and emotions to the essential life energy within.

This 1 hour introduction to Inner Engineering explains the fundamental approach of the program in a live setting that offers you the opportunity to ask a trained Isha teacher questions about the program and practices available.

“Inner Engineering is neither a religion, nor a philosophy or dogma; It is a technology for wellbeing. One does not have to believe or disbelieve, you just have to learn to use it. Technology will produce results irrespective of who you are.” – Sadhguru

results.description:
Join us in reading and discussion around Juan Gonzalez's book, Harvest of Empire - A History of Latinos in America. In an interview with Democracy Now! Gonzalez describes the book: 

 
“[T]he central theme of Harvest of Empire is that…you cannot understand the enormous Latino presence in the United States unless you understand America’s role in Latin America, and in fact that the Latino presence in the country is the harvest of the empire. It is the result of more than a century of domination of many of these countries. And in fact, those countries that were most dominated by the United States are the ones that have sent the most migrants to this country. And Cuba, Puerto Rico, the Dominican Republic, Mexico, [El] Salvador, Guatemala, these are the countries that have provided the bulk of the migration from Latin America, largely many of them fleeing from the civil wars, as in the cases of Guatemala and Nicaragua and El Salvador, in which the United States government played a key role in backing one side or the other, others coming here as a result of the needs of American businesses that established migration and recruiting, actually recruited people to come here to fill jobs—that’s more so in the case of the Puerto Ricans and the Mexicans. And so, in essence…the mass migration flows of Latin Americans to this country were a direct response to the needs of the empire. Most Americans are not aware of that, because most Americans don’t even think of our country as an empire.“[W]hat I’ve tried to do in the book is chart how each of the different Latino groups came, what was happening in their country that forced them to leave…what cities did they first arrive in, how did they establish their communities, what kind of hostility or welcome did they meet when they arrived in these various cities around the country, and basically tried to…paint a picture, the human picture, of how it was that this country is now facing this enormous explosion of Latino population."

Because of space limitations, a maximum of 16 people can attend. Please be mindful when you RSVP that a waitlist is likely and update your RSVP if you're unable to attend or commit to reading the book.  

See you then!
results.name: Knapsack Book Discussion: Harvest of Empire - A History of Latinos in America

results.description:
Hello ASL Enthusiasts!

WHAT: ASL Weekly Social
WHEN: EVERY SUNDAY 
TIME: 4:00-6:00PM
WHO: ANYONE is welcome to come by and have a conversation in ASL
WHY: To socialize, have fun, and enjoy chatting in ASL
WHERE: Tavern in the Square in Porter Square

NOTE: Every once a while, the location may change. PLEASE look on the website each week for confirmation. THANKS!


To get to the Meetup, take the RED LINE stop OUTBOUND TO ALEWIFE, and stop at PORTER SQ. Look down the street. There's Tavern in the Square! If you're driving, you can park on the street for free on Sundays!

Anyone who loves ASL is welcome to come and be part of the fun! We want to warmly extend an invitation to Deaf people or others fluent/skilled in the language (CODAs for example) to join our group.

This is an easy-going, casual, ASL get-together to meet people who enjoy American Sign Language, who want to brush up on their signing skills, and want to learn more ASL by using it as often as possible.

We strive to have a good time and communicate without using voices. If we need to, we draw or write what we don't know how to sign, and if lots of folks show up, we split up into small groups and mix and mingle, so we can actually see one another clearly, face-to-face and get a good conversation going.

Don't be afraid or shy if you're not "perfect" at ASL, because being "perfect" is not the point of this group. No one expects that everyone will be at the same level, and none of us mind slowing down or repeating what we have signed so that everyone understands.

We all laugh WITH one another as we fumble along, mess things up, and start over again. This isn't an ASL class, since none of us are certified ASL teachers, so there's really no pressure or expectation--other than that we all use ASL to communicate. We all learn from one another!

IF you've taken an ASL/Sign Language class before (or have had exposure to someone who uses the language) and know the basics (alphabet, numbers 1-20, and even a small vocabulary of signs ), then join us to get your fingers, hands, face and body moving, ASL-style!

IF you haven't taken an ASL class, or don't know the basics, don't be discouraged ... you can come along anyway and learn by watching, and gradually, participating. We have lots of resources that we can suggest for learning ASL from a qualified teacher or authentic source, such as books, online classes, and local classes at various locations near Boston.

If you can, "officially" RSVP, even if the RSVP is "No," so that we know who is definitely going to come.

It will be great to see folks!

Erika and Jack
results.how_to_find_us: We will be there signing our beautiful language to inspire all of you!
results.name: ASL WEEKLY SOCIAL

results.description:
Come join us at our new home for the start of the 2015 season as the Ravens visit the Denver Broncos! We've moved to Causeway Restaurant on Causeway Street across from TD Garden.


The second floor of Causeway will be Ravens Central for this game and every game for this season (and hopefully seasons to come)


Getting there: Take the T (Orange & Green Lines + Commuter Rail) to North Station. Red Line riders can either transfer at Park Street or Downtown Crossing to Green/Orange respectively or exit at the Charles/MGH stop and make the approximately 10 minute walk to the bar.


Address: 65 Causeway St., Boston.


Silent Auction: 

Items are mostly autographed photos of Ravens players (all authenticated by Dino's Authentics in Baltimore) Bidding starts at 4 PM and will end during halftime.  Be sure to check out the memorabilia table and make some bids! We take check, cash, PayPal and Venmo.  Proceeds go to Ravens Nation North.

We've got Baltimore beer and food as well with our custom "Ravens Fan" menu. If you've never been with us, don't miss out. You'll feel like your in Baltimore on game day, hon! 

See you at Causeway!

results.description:
Give yourself the gift of relaxation and rejuvenation with a wonderful 90 minute gentle yoga and meditation class.

True relaxation is experienced by the body and mind when little or no energy is consumed. It is Nature's way of recharging. Since every action, conscious or unconscious, uses stored energy, relaxation is necessary for good health and peace of mind. Without proper relaxation the body and mind become overworked and inefficient.

When the mind is constantly bombarded by stimuli, it becomes overloaded and exhausted. We may be unaware that we are doing it, but by thinking and worrying we are using up tremendous amounts of energy. The tension put on the mind by worries can use more energy than physical work.

Yoga retrains the body to relax and can calm the mind which leads to inner peace.

This class is for beginners and experienced yogi's.  Chairs are available for those who may need to sit during this class.  Please bring your own yoga mat, water and a blanket or pillow for meditation.
results.name: Gentle Yoga & Meditation - 90 minute class

group.name: The Light Within - Yoga, Reiki, Meditation - Dorchester MA

</a>

Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24 (MUST register with code ATWYS- codes can not be applied after registration)

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: 

<a href="https://2015bostonatwysspeeddating.eventbrite.com">https://2015bostonatwysspeeddating.eventbrite.com


(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS. NO EXCEPTIONS.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.name: THE MANY FACES OF EGO

results.description:
This is an ongoing weekly (donation only) class for anyone, offering experiential practice in meditation, along with an opportunity to be among others interested in deepening spiritutual practices.  The class provides you with a felt sense of your own divinity; your Higher Self. The meditation, based on Kriya practices,  is partly guided, partly silent. In the guided part we open up to the flow of golden light and energy that is always pouring down to our body/mind/heart and being. Accessing that flow and inviting it to fill us brings a profound level of openness, while washing away limiting thoughts, feelings and beliefs. This higher vibration of unconditional love serves to open our consciousness to new levels of peace, joy and awakening. Bringing the flow of light into the body/mind/heart means we more consciously embody our Light Being, so we are more present, happy, forgiving, peaceful and joyful while in the world.
   After the guided portion we spend time in peaceful silence.  Whether you are an experienced meditator or a beginner, you will love the sweetness and powerful energies of this group. At the end of the class we make time for questions or sharing.  Group meditation is powerful, and it's refreshing to be among fellow travelers!
   Judy also teaches the Sound and Light meditation; a way for you to draw your senses inward to open your spiritual eye and to hear the sounds of your chakras. 
   This practice is non-denominational, appropriate for anyone. 
   Held in a lovely healing space, just walking in will bring you instant peace.  All are welcome.
    You may also want to check out my other Meetup, for a variety of spiritual programs:  http://www.meetup.com/Evolving-Beings/

results.description:
Let's join 20+ others from six other walking groups for:

Since May 2012, there has been a regular walk around Fresh Pond at about an hour before sunset. Frequently, 20-25 walkers turn out for this walk, and you can too. There are a whole bunch of regulars, along with some new people.

We'll go out to dinner at a local pub or chinese restaurant - you can get a decent dinner for under $10.

Frequently, if we eat too much food, we'll go for another walk.

Come see why this walk is so popular. It's at a great time, the people are friendly, the parking is free -- no permit parking in Cambridge on Sunday, so you can park on Huron or Aberdeen Ave.

You can get there by T easily from Harvard Square, take the 71 OR 73 bus to Aberdeen Ave, then walk to the other end of Aberdeen Ave, and you'll see us there. We'll be next to the bridge, on the pond side of Huron Ave,at the intersection of Aberdeen Ave.

If you're late, and we've already started, start walking counter-clockwise. We'll be walking clockwise, so we'll surely bump into each other. We're the large group of vigorously chatting walkers.

Hope to see you there.

Shangri La is located at 149 Belmont Street, Belmont - please let the host know if you're coming, so we can get the right sized table.
results.name: Large,Multigroup Weekly Walk around Fresh Pond,dinner @ Shangri-La :9/13@6:00

results.description:
Can we address the extreme weather effects of global warming by direct action on water cycles? Our upcoming October conference, Restoring Water Cycles to Reverse Global Warming, will demonstrate the possibilities featuring presentations by internationally renowned Slovakian hydrologist Michal Kravcik (author of Water for the Recovery of the Climate: A New Water Paradigm) and Canadian water rights activist and Maude Barlow (chair of the board of Food and Water Watch), among others.  


At our September 13th Meetup, Biodiversity for a Livable Climate Program Coordinator Brian Cartwright will present a conference sneak preview to introduce us to the New Water Paradigm which is the framework for the event. Brian will highlight a variety of successful large and small scale methods for keeping water circulating in local landscapes, supporting vegetation and biodiverse species working cooperatively.

Join us from 6:00-7:00 p.m. for a potluck and informal networking before Brian begins his presentation. We look forward to seeing you there!

Cheers,

The Biodiversity for a Livable Climate team
results.how_to_find_us: 1 Fayette Park, Cambridge, MA 02139
results.name: A New Water Paradigm: Restoring Water Cycles to Reverse Global Warming (Preview)

results.description:
8/24 update - We picked the book. I'm giving it a reread, but it's new to everyone else that was able to make it on Sunday. It is Michelle's first book suggestion. (Go, Michelle!) This is one of my favorite books and it's been about 15 years since I read it the first time, so I'm looking forward to this. It's a short book, which is good because you have 3 weeks to read it.

We haven't picked the book yet, but I wanted to get this on the schedule.

We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

All are welcome to attend and no RSVP is needed.

 

This is offered FREE OF CHARGE as a community service

results.description:
Please join us as we gather together to reconnect with our community and begin our new season with an evening of meditation, movement, discussion and social interaction. The evening will conclude with light refreshments in the Community Room (you are invited to bring something for the refreshments table to share with the group).

The LGBT Meditation Group offers a safe space for those who identify as queer, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, or questioning to come together to explore the practice of meditation and support each other in community. Previous meditation experience is not required.
results.name: LGBT Meditation Group — Awakening to Our Community

results.description:
"Your task is not to seek for love, but merely to seek and find all the barriers within yourself that you have built against it." —Rumi

Register to join 

30-DAY DATE YOURSELF CHALLENGE/A Self+Love Experience  

Followed by potluck dinner on OCTOBER 17th, 2015

location TBD

When we have a greater understanding of self, live authentically and establish more balance in our lives for self care, we tend to have more joy.  This leaves us available to be more loving to others.

When we live [lead] from a place of love, we are serving ourselves and also the world.

Most of us, when we think of service, envision philanthropic donations, volunteer work, and sacrifices of large and other grand gestures. While acts of service can indeed be all those things, serving others doesn’t have to be complicated or over the top. It can be an encouraging word, smile, or gentle hug. Or be as simple as supporting the goals of others or gifting your expertise to help empower another.

Because we are all interconnected, when I Love me, I also Love you. Together through our Love, we can heal ourselves, each other, and the world.

I created the 30-Day Date Yourself Challenge as a gift of Love. I have learned that when we live from a state of Love, everything good is drawn to us.  That is the only fundamental underlying constant. When we awaken to our essential loving, spiritual nature, we let go of old fears and defenses and connect with others through Love.

If you haven’t registered for the 30-Day Date Yourself Challenge ~ A Self+Love Experience I encourage you join now for FREE and share this gift of Love to your friends and loved ones to join you in this life-enhancing experience.

I look forward to doing this challenge with you in great anticipation, knowing that together we are creating an experience of expanded consciousness that is increasing LOVEthroughout the world.

With Love, 

Chenoa
results.how_to_find_us: Lets live limitlessly!!
results.name: FREE online 30 Day Date Yourself Challenge

results.description:
Hi all Docker-lovers!

In preparation for the Docker Global Hackday #3 (http://www.meetup.com/Docker-Boston/events/224589977/)
Jonas Rosland (@jonasrosland) and the great folks at EMC {code} (http://emccode.github.io) are hosting a repeat of the day-long, hands-on workshop on Docker fundamentals at EMC's new community space in Kendall Square.

The event is intended for Docker beginners, so if you're wondering which orchestration tool you should implement or worried about how to run large-scale L2 networks this is NOT the event for you.

Because this is a training workshop, attendance is capped to 30 people to ensure that everyone gets personalized attention. So, if you're new to Docker and looking for a great introduction, this will is a great opportunity to get a hands-on introduction to the fundamentals.


PRE-REQUISITES:

Please bring your own laptop with The Docker Toolbox (https://www.docker.com/toolbox) installed.


AGENDA:

PART I: Introduction to Docker
Overview, 1h
Docker ecosystem, 20 min
• Network
• Storage
• Management

Break

LAB I: Run your first container

• Start it
• See the logs
• See which ports are open
• Connect to the container

Provided Lunch

Lab 2: Building containers with Dockerfiles

• Write your first Dockerfile
• Build your first container
• Run it and repeat the previous lab

Break

PART II: Docker in Production

This section explores the issues in running Docker in a production environment, which is exactly what you'll want to do after the training is over :)

• Introduction to clustering
• CoreOS
• Docker Machine and Swarm
• Starting a cluster
• Resource scheduling
• Service discovery (etcd, Consul, Zookeeper, etc)
• High availability
results.name: Getting Started with Docker Workshop #3

results.description:

They will restrict numbers so that Marmalade doesn't become overwhelmed and so the children get the most out of the experience, therefore try to arrive a little early if possible.
results.name: Mornings with Marmalade

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.
results.name: Monday Lunchtime Soccer (OUTDOOR)

results.description:
Join us on Monday, September 14th afternoon for an informative session organized by Business France and hosted by MassBio about the Bostonian ecosystem

1:30 - 1:50pm Introduction : Trends and market update

Speaker: Don Seiffert, BioFlash Editor, Boston Business Journal

1:50 - 2:40pm Session 1 : Management strategies for emerging infectious diseases

Moderator: Stephen Zinner, Charles S. Davidson Distinguished Professor of Medicine at Harvard Medical School, and Immediate Past Chair, Department of Medicine at Mount Auburn Hospital

Speakers : Martin Hirsch, Professor of Infectious Diseases and Immunology at the Harvard School of Public Health, and a senior physician in the Infectious Diseases Service at the Massachusetts General Hospital; Andrew Levin Founder, President and Chief Scientific Officer at Immunetics; Jean-Pierre Sommadossi Chariman, CEO and Founder of Atea Pharmaceuticals; Michael Wong, Senior Director, Infectious Diseases at Sarepta Therapeutics.

2:40 - 3:00pm : Break / Networking

3:00 - 3:50pm Session 2 : Immunotherapies at the rescue of oncology

Moderator: Kuldeep Neote, Senior Director, New Ventures, Johnson & Johnson Innovation

Speakers : John Gustofson, Sr. Director, Ventures & Early Stage Collaborations at Abbvie; Mark Poznansky Associate Professor of Medicine at HMS, Physician in MGH Division of Infectious Diseases, and Director of the Vaccine and Immunotherapy Center.

3:50 - 4:40pm Session 3 : What are the new perspectives to face antibiotic resistance?

Moderator: Stephen Calderwood, President of the Infectious Diseases Society of America and Chief, Division of Infectious Diseases at MGH.

Speakers: David Hooper, Associate Chief of Division of Infectious Diseases at MGH and Chief, Infection Control at MGH; David Skurnik, Assistant Professor of Medicine, Harvard Medical School & Co-Founder of MTAnalytics; Ruben Tommasi, Chief Scientific Officer at Entasis Therapeutics; Michael Gilmore, Director of Schepens Eye Research institute, PI of the Harvard-wide NIH Program Project grant on antimicrobial resistance, and one of Directors of the Boston Area Antimicrobial Resistance Network.

This event is also the occasion to bring together US & French entities interested in exploring collaborative opportunities in Immunology, Infectiology & Vaccines.

Free RSVP Required!
http://www.eventbrite.com/e/informative-networking-session-immunology-infectious-diseases-vaccines-tickets-18318131023
results.name: Immunology, Infectious Diseases, Vaccines

results.description:
Looking to make big improvements in your English ability quickly? Consider our evening course designed to enable efficient, intensive lessons and practice with 2 hours of class per day, 2 days a week for 10 weeks. We offer lower and upper intermediate courses. Unfortunately, we do not offer beginner courses at this time. Register ASAP by taking a placement test due a week before class starts, either at our location or by emailing us at [masked].

PLEASE NOTE THAT YOU WON'T BE ABLE TO JOIN THE COURSE IF YOU DIDN'T DO THE TEST AND REGISTER BEFORE.

results.description:
Couch to 5K Fall Group
Interested in getting in shape but don’t know where to begin? Want to meet s

We have 2 groups:

1. Our Jogging Group has a goal of jogging a 5K.
2. Our Alumni Jogging Group has a goal of keep jogging for those who have jogged at least once season with us.

We introduce people to jogging and getting fit. The program gradually moves you from walking at your own pace to jogging at your own pace.

• FREE 10-week program to get you from the couch to running a 5K (3.1 miles) 

• Anyone from the community can participate

• Led by experienced runners

• Monday through Thursdays 6pm-6:45pm; Sundays 8am-8:45am, with a goal of joining us 3 of these sessions per week.

• 45 minute time commitment

• Goal of jogging and finishing the Stow Gobbler on Thanksgiving morning.

Encourage those you love to get “off the couch” and join you in the great sport of running. Come have some fun! Bring a water bottle and join the group.

Please consult your doctor if you have a health or medical condition that prevents you from exercising.

For more information please visit http://www.connectingpointchurch.org/couchto5k/
results.name: Couch to 5K Autumn Edition

results.description:
Hi Ladies:

We will be discussing the Chapter on DESIRE - technically the first chapter (depending on which version you have).  YOU CAN ATTEND THIS ONE EVEN IF YOU MISSED THE FIRST GATHERING.....that was just the introduction.

I borrowed the book  "Think & Grow Rich" from a good friend and just finished it.  I loved it so much I went to B&N to purchase my own copy to re-read and put more time into the work assignments and was pleased to find they have a workbook to supplement the original book.  

There are 14 Chapters to this amazing book:

Desire, Faith, Auto Suggestion, Specialized Knowledge, Imagination, Organized Planning, Decision, Persistence, Power of the Master Mind, They Mystery of Sex Transmutation, The Subconscious Mind, The Brain, The Sixth Sense and How to Outwit the Six Ghosts of Fear

While this book title is  about "Growing Rich" in terms of money it also helps with Growing Rich in terms of living a full filling happy life:)

B&N offers a "Master Mind Volume and workbook set for $29.99 or you can just pick up the the original copy for under $8.00 

We will cover a Chapter per month or every 3 weeks or soand thoroughly discuss it, share with each other and learn from one another.

This is a food establishment, a food purchase is required:)

Please no perfumes or fragrances, we have members with allergies.

Please be respectful of the Organizers who put time and effort into posting and hosting events.  If you RSVP for an event, please plan on showing up for that event.  

Same day cancellations WILL count as  no show.
results.name: Think and Grow Rich Book Review - Chapter On - DESIRE

results.description:
WE ARE BACK IN DAVIS SQUARE FOR TONIGHT, PLEASE TAKE NOTE OF THIS.

6:30-6:45 pm - Warm up & practice, we'll work on some throws, passes & catches.

6:45 pm - Game starts.

General guidelines: Dress accordingly. Bring a white & dark shirt so we can easily divide into 2 teams. Have plenty of water. Sunscreen on a sunny day. Stretch & warm up. We'll provide discs and cones.

Weather: Rain in New England is unpredictable. We will send out a final notice one hour before start time if cancellation is necessary.

RSVP: Very helpful as this is how we contact you in case of game changes & cancellations.

About: Playing Ultimate is all about good sportsmanship, respect, and gracefulness on the field.  Fun & having a good time is a must above anything else. It's an easy game to pick up & we keep the rules minimal. No zones, no stall count, no scores, and players self-officiate on the field.  Open to all levels of players.  Beginners welcome.

Warning: Excessive fun & comradery developed from playing Ultimate may become addicting.

results.description:
Hi everyone! 

I am delighted to officially announce our next W3C Developers meetup!

 We might have one or two short talks before the TAG session. More information coming soon.

Part 1 - Crosscloud -- a SoLiD effort to redecentralize the Web

Andrei Sambra will talk about Crosscloud -- an exciting new project (lead by Sir Tim Berners-Lee) that involves redecentralizing the Web, resulting in true data ownership as well as improved privacy.

Crosscloud gives users the freedom to choose where their data resides and who is allowed to access it by decoupling content from the application itself. Because applications are decoupled from the data they produce, users will be able to avoid vendor lock-in by seamlessly switching the apps and personal data storage servers, without losing any data or social connections.


Crosscloud also enables developers to easily innovate by creating new apps or improving current apps, all while reusing existing data created by previous apps.


Part 2 - Meet the TAG 

The W3C TAG (Technical Architecture Group http://w3.org/tag) is in charge of coordinating cross-technology architecture and the principles of web architecture at the World Wide Web Consortium - in other words, it’s kind of a technical steering group for web standards. We’re having a face to face meeting in September in Cambridge (hosted at W3C’s offices at MIT).

As part of our time here we'll be holding a Q&A panel session (followed by drinks & snacks) on the evening of September 14th where we can let you know what we're up to and get feedback from the web developer community about your priorities.

Come along find out what we're working on, get a heads-up of new Web standards and technologies in development and air your web tech pet peeves. Key topics on the agenda will be the rise (and rise) of https and web security in general, API design, privacy and browser fingerprinting, and the ongoing “extensible web” work. 

Cheers,

Guillaume
results.name: W3C Developers: Meet the Technical Architecture Group (TAG)

results.description:
NOTE LOCATION CHANGE - LANSDOWNE PUB in the Fenway

NOTE:  The first Monday in September is Labor Day. So we have pushed this out one week to September 14th. See you then!


The September meetings will continue to focus on grassroots activism. While educating ourselves on issues and philosophy is very important, the Greater Boston Tea Party’s original and ongoing objective is to get out there and make an impact, whether that means calling a representative, writing a letter to the editor, working on a campaign / running for office, or as small as correcting your liberal friend on the facts surrounding an issue.

In September there are outstanding opportunities for growth and outreach in several areas - both in events and items to be active on. Events to note:

•  The Latest Facts on Amnesty - A Couple of Concerned Citizens: Barbara From Harlem and Jessica Vaughan (Sept 19 - Marloborough MA - see event link and RSVP!)

• NHCCS: “Constitution Day 2015″ Federalism – State Rights: “Democracy’s Redemption” (Sept. 20 - Portsmouth NH)


• Boston and Worcester Tea Parties Present an Evening with Charles Murray (Sept 22 - at HARVARD UNIVERSITY - see event link and RSVP via Eventbrite or VIP seating links)


Those meetings are mainly informational in nature, but provide opportunities to invite new people on some if the issues which are greatly affecting our country now.

Another opportunity will be the End Common Core MA Ballot Initiative. This will begin in earnest in mid-September and we will have through November to gather the 100,000 raw (to reach 65,000 certified signatures to get the question on the ballot. There are many other ways to get involved as well. We will be discussing current and upcoming issues, events, and how to get involved. We are also looking for members to share their own stories and ideas.

We can turn back the tide of creeping government intrusion into our lives – come join us to discuss how!
results.name: Boston Meeting - Greater Boston Tea Party

results.description:
Dr. Pamela Silver:
What is Synthetic Biology?

Join us on September 14th at 7:00pm at the Burren, for Science by the Pint.

Dr. Pamela Silver and her lab work at the interface between systems and synthetic biology to design and build biological systems in both mammalian and prokaryotic cells. They seek to both enhance our understanding of natural biological design, and to develop tools and concepts for designing cells, tissues and organisms.  In the long term, they hope to develop principles for building synthetic cells that act as sensors, memory devices, bio-computers, producers of high value commodities and energy from the sun, and to build novel subsystems such as proteins with designed properties for therapeutic use. They seek to address ‘big’ unanswered questions that could have an impact on people and the world through engineered biological systems

Science by the Pint is sponsored by an organization of Harvard graduate students called Science in the News.  In between their sleepless hours of hard work at Harvard Med School, they bring cutting edge scientific research to the public in a fun and informal format. 


The Burren is located on Elm Street right in the heart of Davis Square, just a short walk from the Red Line stop.  If you prefer to drive, there are metered spots on the street and in nearby municipal lots (see link below).  Meters are active until 8:00 PM, and metered spots are free thereafter. Municipal lot meters are good for three hours, and street spots are good for two.

Links:

<a>Dr. Silver's Lab</a>


SITN Facebook Page

SITN: Science by the Pint

The Burren

Davis Square Parking
